translations.text: (Do they then like for Allah) a creature who is brought up in adornments (wearing silk and gold ornaments, i.e. women), and in dispute cannot make herself clear?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: “Someone brought up to be beautiful, and unable to help in a fight?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Do they assign to Allah one who grows up amidst ornaments and is not well-versed in the art of disputation?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: A creature who is brought up in adornments, and who in dispute cannot make itself clear

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: (Liken they then to Allah) that which is bred up in outward show, and in dispute cannot make itself plain?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: ‘What! One who is brought up amid ornaments and is inconspicuous in contests?’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: (As such they attribute to Allah) who is brought up among ornaments but when disputes arise are powerless.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So is one brought up in ornaments while being during conflict unevident [attributed to Allah]?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Does God choose for Himself the kind of children who grow up wearing ornaments and who are not strong enough to defend their rights?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: What! that which is made in ornaments and which in contention is unable to make plain speech!

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Awaman yunashshao fee alhilyati wahuwa fee alkhisami ghayru mubeenin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: ["Do you ascribe to God] one who is brought up among ornaments and who cannot produce a cogent argument?"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Is then one brought up among trinkets, and unable to give a clear account in a dispute (to be associated with Allah)?

verses.text: وَ جَعَلُوا الْمَلاَئِکَةَ الَّذِينَ‌ هُمْ‌ عِبَادُ الرَّحْمٰنِ‌ إِنَاثاً أَ شَهِدُوا خَلْقَهُمْ‌ سَتُکْتَبُ‌ شَهَادَتُهُمْ‌ وَ يُسْأَلُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و فرشتگان را که بندگان [خدای] رحمان اند، به پندار خود جنس ماده قرارداده اند، آیا زمان آفرینش آنان حضور داشتند [که بر ماده بودنشان گواهی می دهند؟] به زودی گواهی آنان [در نامه اعمالشان] نوشته می شود و [درباره آن] مورد بازپرسی قرار خواهند گرفت.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و فرشتگان را كه بندگان خدايند زن پنداشتند. آيا به هنگام خلقتشان آنجا حاضر بوده‌اند؟ زودا كه اين شهادتشان را مى‌نويسند و از آنها بازخواست مى‌شود.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و فرشتگانى را كه بندگان رحمانند، مؤنث پنداشتند. آيا در آفرينش آنها حضور داشته‌اند؟ زودا كه گواهى ايشان نوشته شود و بازخواست شوند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و فرشتگانى را كه خود، بندگان رحمانند، مادينه [و دختران او] پنداشتند. آيا در خلقت آنان حضور داشتند؟ گواهى ايشان به زودى نوشته مى‌شود و [از آن‌] پرسيده خواهند شد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و فرشتگان را که مخلوق و بندگان خدا هستند دختر می‌خوانند. آیا در وقت خلقت آنها حاضر بودند؟ (و دیدند که آنها دخترند؟ اگر آنها بر این گواهی دهند) البته شهادت (کذب) شان (در نامه عملشان) نوشته شده و بر آن سخت مؤاخذه می‌شوند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آنان فرشتگان را که بندگان خدای مهربانند، مؤنّث بشمار می‌آورند (و دختران خدا قلمداد می‌نمایند!). آیا ایشان به هنگام آفرینش فرشتگان حضور داشته‌اند و خِلقتشان را مشاهده نموده‌اند؟! اظهارنظر و گواهی ایشان (بر این عقیده‌ی بی‌اساس، در نامه‌های اعمالشان) ثبت و ضبط می‌شود و (در روز قیامت، از سوی خدا) بازخواست می‌گردند. [[«جَعَلُوا الْمَلآئِکَةَ ... إِنَاثاً»: (نگا: اسراء / 40، صافّات / 150).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و مدعی شدند که فرشتگان که خود بندگان خداوند رحمان‌اند، مادینه‌اند، آیا آفرینش آنان را شاهد بوده‌اند؟ که [در این صورت‌] زودا که شهادت ایشان نوشته شود، و بازخواست شوند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنها فرشتگان را که بندگان خداوند رحمانند مؤنّث پنداشتند؛ آیا شاهد آفرینش آنها بوده اند؟! گواهی آنان نوشته می‌شود و (از آن) بازخواست خواهند شد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و قرار دادند فرشتگانی را که بندگان خدای مهربانند مادگانی آیا گواه شدند آفرینش آنان را زود است نوشته شود گواهیشان و پرسش شوند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و فرشتگان را كه بندگان خداى رحمان‌اند دختران نام نهادند. آيا به هنگام آفرينش ايشان حاضر و گواه بوده‌اند- تا بدانند كه از كدام جنس‌اند-؟! زودا كه گواهيشان نوشته شود و از آنان پرسش و بازخواست خواهد شد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و فرشتگانی را که خود، بندگان رحمانند، مادینه (و دختران او) قرار دادند. آیا در خلقت آنان حضور داشتند؟ گواهی (گزاف) ایشان به زودی نوشته می‌شود و (از آن) پرسیده می‌شوند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Yet they have made the angels, who are creatures of Ar-Rahman, females. Did they witness their creation? We shall record their testimony, and they will be interrogated.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And they appoint the angels, who are the bondmen of the Most Gracious, as females; were they present at the time of the angels’ creation? Their declaration will be now recorded and they will be questioned.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And they have made the angels, who are themselves servants of the All-merciful, females. What, did they witness their creation? Their witness shall be written down, and they shall be questioned.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And they make the angels who are the bondmen of the Compassionate females. Have they witnessed their creation? Their testimony will be written down, and they will be questioned.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And they make the angels who themselves are slaves to the Most Beneficent (Allah) females. Did they witness their creation? Their evidence will be recorded, and they will be questioned!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And they appoint the angels, who are servants to the Most Gracious, as females. Have they witnessed their creation? Their claim will be recorded, and they will be questioned.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They claim that angels, who are Allah's chosen servants, are females. Did they witness how their body is constituted? Their testimony shall be written and they shall be called to account.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And they make females the angels who themselves are servants of the Most Gracious. Did they witness their creation Their testimony will be recorded, and they will be questioned!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And they make the angels, who are the slaves of the Beneficent, females. Did they witness their creation? Their testimony will be recorded and they will be questioned.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They have made the angels—who are servants of the All-beneficent—females. Were they witness to their creation? Their testimony will be written down and they shall be questioned.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: They claim that the angels, who are themselves the worshipers of the Merciful, are females. Did they witness their creation! Their witness shall be written down and they shall be questioned.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And they have made the angels, who are servants of the Most Merciful, females. Did they witness their creation? Their testimony will be recorded, and they will be questioned.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do they say that the angels, who are the servants of the Beneficent God, are females? Have they witnessed their creation? Their words as such will be recorded and they will be questioned for it.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And they make the angels-- them who are the servants of the Beneficent Allah-- female (divinities). What! did they witness their creation? Their evidence shall be written down and they shall be questioned.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: WajaAAaloo almalaikata allatheena hum AAibadu alrrahmani inathan ashahidoo khalqahum satuktabu shahadatuhum wayusaloona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They consider the angels, God's servants, to be female. Did they witness their creation? Their claim will be put on record and they will be questioned about it.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And they make into females angels who themselves serve Allah. Did they witness their creation? Their evidence will be recorded, and they will be called to account!

verses.text: وَ قَالُوا لَوْ شَاءَ الرَّحْمٰنُ‌ مَا عَبَدْنَاهُمْ‌ مَا لَهُمْ‌ بِذٰلِکَ‌ مِنْ‌ عِلْمٍ‌ إِنْ‌ هُمْ‌ إِلاَّ يَخْرُصُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و گفتند: اگر خدا می خواست ما آنان را نمی پرستیدیم. ادعایشان متکی بر هیچ [دلیل] و دانشی نیست [و مایه ای جز جهل و نادانی ندارد]، فقط حدس می زنند و دروغ می بافند؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفتند: اگر خداى رحمان مى‌خواست ما فرشتگان را نمى‌پرستيديم. آنچه مى‌گويند از روى نادانى است و جز به دروغ سخن نمى‌گويند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و گفتند: اگر خداى رحمان مى‌خواست، آنها را نمى‌پرستيديم. آنان به اين [سخن‌] علم ندارند و جز دروغ نمى‌گويند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و مى‌گويند: «اگر [خداى‌] رحمان مى‌خواست، آنها را نمى‌پرستيديم.» آنان به اين [دعوى‌] دانشى ندارند [و] جز حدس نمى‌زنند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و مشرکان گویند: اگر خدا می‌خواست ما آنها (فرشتگان و بتان) را نمی‌پرستیدیم. گفتار آنها نه از روی علم و دانش است بلکه به وهم و پندار باطل خویش می‌گویند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و می‌گویند: اگر خدا می‌خواست ما فرشتگان را پرستش نمی‌کردیم. آنان کمترین اطّلاع و کوچکترین خبری از این (رضایت الهی) ندارند! ایشان سخنانشان جز بر پایه‌ی حدس و گمان و تخمین نیست. [[«لَوْ شَآءَ الرَّحْمنُ»: مشرکان تنها برای توجیه عقائد فاسد و اعمال خرافی خود چنین سخنی می‌گفتند. درست است که در عالم هستی چیزی بی‌اراده خدا واقع نمی‌شود، ولی خدا خواسته است که ما مختار و صاحب آزادی اراده باشیم. خود آنان اگر کسی حقوقی از ایشان را پایمال می‌کرد، هرگز از مجازات او چشم‌پوشی نمی‌کردند و نمی‌گفتند: چه مانعی است، دست تقدیر چنین کرده است. «یَخْرُصُونَ»: تخمین می‌زنند و ناسنجیده می‌گویند (نگا: انعام / 116 و 148، یونس / 66).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و گویند اگر خداوند رحمان می‌خواست ما آنان [فرشتگان‌] را نمی‌پرستیدیم، آنان را به این امر، علمی نیست، ایشان جز دروغ نمی‌بافند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنان گفتند: «اگر خداوند رحمان می‌خواست ما آنها را پرستش نمی‌کردیم!» ولی به این امر هیچ گونه علم و یقین ندارند و جز دروغ چیزی نمی‌گویند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و گفتند اگر می‌خواست خداوند مهربان نمی‌پرستیدیمشان نیستشان بدان دانشی نیستند آنان جز آنکه دروغ می‌گویند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و گفتند: اگر خداى رحمان مى‌خواست آنها را نمى‌پرستيديم. آنان را بدان [سخن‌] هيچ دانشى نيست اينان جز دروغ و گزاف نمى‌گويند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و گفتند: «اگر رحمان می‌خواست، ما آنها را نمی‌پرستیدیم.» آنان به این (دعوی) هیچ دانایی ندارند (و) جز حدسی به گزاف نمی‌زنند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Yet they say: "If Ar-Rahman had so pleased we would not have worshipped them." They have no knowledge of it in the least. They only make up lies.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And they say, “If the Most Gracious had willed, we would not have worshipped them!” They do not know its truth at all; they only make guesses.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: They say, 'Had the All-merciful so willed, we would not have served them.' They have no knowledge of that; they are only conjecturing.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And they say: had the Compassionate willed we should not have worshipped them. They have no knowledge thereof; they are only guessing.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And they said: "If it had been the Will of the Most Beneficent (Allah), we should not have worshipped them (false deities)." They have no knowledge whatsoever of that. They do nothing but lie!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And they say, “Had the Most Gracious willed, we would not have worshiped them.” But they have no knowledge of that; they are merely guessing.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They say: “Had the Merciful One so willed, we would never have worshipped these deities.” But they have no knowledge of the matter and are simply conjecturing.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And they said: "If it had been the will of the Most Gracious, we should not have worshipped them." They have no knowledge whatsoever of that. They do nothing but lie!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And they say: If the Beneficent One had (so) willed, we should not have worshipped them. They have no knowledge whatsoever of that. They do but guess.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They say, ‘Had the All-beneficent wished, we would not have worshipped them.’ They do not have any knowledge of that, and they do nothing but surmise.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: They say: 'Had it been the will of the Merciful, we would never have worshipped them' Of this they have no knowledge, they are but guessing.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And they said, "If the Most Merciful had willed, we would not have worshipped them." They have of that no knowledge. They are not but falsifying.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The pagans say, "Had the Beneficent God wanted, we would not have worshipped them (idols)." Whatever they say is not based on knowledge. It is only a false conjecture.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And they say: If the Beneficent Allah had pleased, we should never have worshipped them. They have no knowledge of this; they only lie.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waqaloo law shaa alrrahmanu ma AAabadnahum ma lahum bithalika min AAilmin in hum illa yakhrusoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They say, "If the All Merciful had so willed, we would not have worshipped them." They have no knowledge of that. They are only conjecturing.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: ("Ah!") they say, "If it had been the will of (Allah) Most Gracious, we should not have worshipped such (deities)!" Of that they have no knowledge! they do nothing but lie!

verses.text: أَمْ‌ آتَيْنَاهُمْ‌ کِتَاباً مِنْ‌ قَبْلِهِ‌ فَهُمْ‌ بِهِ‌ مُسْتَمْسِکُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: یا مگر ما پیش از قرآن کتابی به آنان داده ایم که [برای اثبات ادعایشان] به آن تمسک می جویند؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا پيش از قرآن كتابى برايشان نازل كرده‌ايم كه اكنون بدان تمسك مى‌جويند؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا [ما] پيش از اين كتابى به آنها داده‌ايم، كه بدان تمسك مى‌جويند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا به آنان پيش از آن [قرآن‌] كتابى داده‌ايم كه بدان تمسك مى‌جويند؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: یا مگر بر آنها از این پیش کتابی فرستادیم که (در این سخن جبر و عقیده باطل) به آن کتاب استدلال می‌کنند؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: یا این که ما کتابی را پیش از این قرآن، بدانان داده‌ایم و آنان بدان چنگ زده‌اند (و آن کتاب افتراء ایشان را تأیید می‌کند؟). [[«أَمْ»: ما بعد خود را عطف بر (أَشَهِدُوا خَلْقَهُمْ) می‌سازد. «قَبْلِهِ»: پیش از قرآن.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: یا شاید به آنان کتابی پیش از آن داده‌ایم که ایشان به آن متمسک‌اند؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: یا اینکه ما کتابی پیش از این به آنان داده‌ایم و آنها به آن تمسّک می‌جویند؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: یا دادیم بدیشان کتابی پیش از آن پس ایشانند بدان چنگ‌زنندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: يا مگر [در اين باره‌] آنان را پيش از اين [قرآن‌] كتابى داده‌ايم كه بدان چنگ زده‌اند- به آن احتجاج مى‌كنند-؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: یا به آنان پیش از آن (قرآن) کتابی داده‌ایم؛ پس ایشان بدان تمسک جویندگانند؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Did We give them a Scripture before this to which they are holding fast?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Or have We given them some Book before this, to which they hold fast?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Or did We bring them a Book aforetime to which they hold?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Have We vouchsafed Unto them any Book before this, so that they are to it holding fast?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Or have We given them any Book before this (the Quran), to which they are holding fast?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Or have We given them a book prior to this one, to which they adhere?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Or did We bestow upon them a Book before on whose authority they are holding on (to angel-worship)?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Or have We given them any Book before this (the Qur'an) to which they are holding fast

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Or have We given them any scripture before (this Qur'an) so that they are holding fast thereto?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Did We give them a Book before this, so that they are holding fast to it?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Or have We given them a Book before this which they hold fast to?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Or have We given them a book before the Qur'an to which they are adhering?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Had We, before sending the Quran, given them a book to which they now refer as an authority?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Or have We given them a book before it so that they hold fast to it?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Am ataynahum kitaban min qablihi fahum bihi mustamsikoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Have We given them a Book before this, to which they are holding fast?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: What! have We given them a Book before this, to which they are holding fast?

verses.text: بَلْ‌ قَالُوا إِنَّا وَجَدْنَا آبَاءَنَا عَلَى‌ أُمَّةٍ وَ إِنَّا عَلَى‌ آثَارِهِمْ‌ مُهْتَدُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [نه] بلکه [هیچ دلیلی بر حقّانیّت بت پرستی و شرک خود ندارند، بلکه دلگرمی آنان به آیینشان این است که] گفتند: ما پدرانمان را بر آیینی یافتیم و مسلماً ما هم با پیروی از آثارشان ره یافته ایم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: نه، مى‌گويند: پدرانمان را بر آيينى يافتيم و ما از پى آنها مى‌رويم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بلكه گفتند: ما پدران خود را بر آيينى يافته‌ايم و ما بر آثار ايشان هدايت شده‌ايم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [نه،] بلكه گفتند: «ما پدران خود را بر آيينى يافتيم و ما [هم با] پى گيرى از آنان، راه يافتگانيم.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بلکه گفتند: ما پدران خود را به عقاید و آیینی یافتیم و البته ما هم که در پی آنها رویم بر هدایت هستیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بلکه ایشان می‌گویند: ما پدران و نیاکان خود را بر آئینی یافته‌ایم و ما نیز بر پی آنان می‌رویم (و راه بت‌پرستی را در پیش می‌گیریم). [[«آثَارَ»: جمع أَثَر. مراد راه و رسم است (نگا: صافّات / 70). «أُمَّةٍ»: دین وآئین.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بلکه گویند ما پدرانمان را بر شیوه‌ای یافته‌ایم، و با پیروی از آنان رهیافته‌ایم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بلکه آنها می‌گویند: «ما نیاکان خود را بر آئینی یافتیم، و ما نیز به پیروی آنان هدایت یافته‌ایم.»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بلکه گفتند یافتیم پدران خویش را بر ملّتی و مائیم همانا بر نشانیهای آنان پیروان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: [نه،] بلكه گفتند: ما پدرانمان را بر آيينى يافته‌ايم و ما بر پى ايشان رهيافته‌ايم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بلکه گفتند: «ما بی‌گمان پدرانمان را بر روشی (هماهنگ) یافتیم و ما همچنان بر پی آثارشان هدایت‌‌یافتگانیم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: In fact they say: "We found our fathers following a certain way, and are guided by their footprints."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Rather they said, “We found our forefathers upon a religion, and we are following their footsteps.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Nay, but they say, 'We found our fathers upon a community, and we are guided upon their traces.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Nay! they say: verily we have found our fathers on a certain way, and verily by their footsteps we are guided.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Nay! They say: "We found our fathers following a certain way and religion, and we guide ourselves by their footsteps."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But they say, “We found our parents on a course, and we are guided in their footsteps.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Nay; they simply claim: “We found our forefathers on a way, and we continue to find guidance in their footsteps.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Nay! They say: "We found our fathers following a certain way and religion, and we guide ourselves by their footsteps."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Nay, for they say only: Lo! we found our fathers following a religion, and we are guided by their footprints.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: No, they said, ‘We found our fathers following a creed, and we are indeed guided in their footsteps.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: No, but they say: 'We found our fathers following a creed, and by following in their footsteps we are guided.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Rather, they say, "Indeed, we found our fathers upon a religion, and we are in their footsteps [rightly] guided."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: In fact, they say, "We found our fathers following a certain belief and we now follow in their footsteps for our guidance".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Nay! they say: We found our fathers on a course, and surely we are guided by their footsteps.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Bal qaloo inna wajadna abaana AAala ommatin wainna AAala atharihim muhtadoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: No indeed! They say, "We have found our fathers following a certain course, and we are guided by their footsteps."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Nay! they say: "We found our fathers following a certain religion, and we do guide ourselves by their footsteps."

verses.text: وَ کَذٰلِکَ‌ مَا أَرْسَلْنَا مِنْ‌ قَبْلِکَ‌ فِي‌ قَرْيَةٍ مِنْ‌ نَذِيرٍ إِلاَّ قَالَ‌ مُتْرَفُوهَا إِنَّا وَجَدْنَا آبَاءَنَا عَلَى‌ أُمَّةٍ وَ إِنَّا عَلَى‌ آثَارِهِمْ‌ مُقْتَدُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [پیروی کورکورانه و جاهلانه مخصوص اینان نیست] و به همین گونه پیش از تو در هیچ شهری بیم دهنده ای نفرستادیم، مگر آنکه سران خوشگذران و مست و مغرورش گفتند: ما پدرانمان را بر آیینی یافتیم و ما هم حتماً به آثارشان اقتدا می کنیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بدين سان، پيش از تو، به هيچ قريه‌اى بيم‌دهنده‌اى نفرستاديم مگر آنكه متنعمانش گفتند: پدرانمان را بر آيينى يافتيم و ما به اعمال آنها اقتدا مى‌كنيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و همچنين پيش از تو در هيچ شهرى هشدار دهنده‌اى نفرستاديم مگر آن كه خوشگذران‌هاى آن گفتند: ما پدران خود را بر آيينى يافته‌ايم و ما به آثار آنها اقتدا مى‌كنيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و بدين گونه در هيچ شهرى پيش از تو هشداردهنده‌اى نفرستاديم مگر آنكه خوشگذرانان آن گفتند: «ما پدران خود را بر آيينى [و راهى‌] يافته‌ايم و ما از پى ايشان راهسپريم.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و همچنین ما هیچ رسولی پیش از تو در هیچ شهر و دیاری نفرستادیم جز آنکه اهل ثروت و مال آن دیار به رسولان گفتند که ما پدران خود را بر آیین و عقایدی یافتیم و از آنها البته پیروی خواهیم کرد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: همین گونه در هیچ شهر و دیاری پیش از تو (پیغمبر) بیم‌دهنده‌ای مبعوث نکرده‌ایم مگر این که متنعّمان (خوشگذران و مغرور از ثروت و قدرت) آنجا گفته‌اند: ما پدران و نیاکان خود را بر آئینی یافته‌ایم (که بت‌پرستی را بر همگان واجب کرده است) و ما هم قطعاً (بر شیوه‌ی ایشان ماندگار می‌شویم و) به دنبال آنان می‌رویم. [[«کَذلِکَ»: به همین منوال. همین گونه. یعنی مشرکان در همه ادوار، وقتی که از حجّت و برهان درمانده‌اند، سلسله خصومت با حقیقت را جنبانده‌اند، و دست به دامان تقلید زده‌اند. «قَرْیَةٍ»: (نگا: اعراف / 94، فرقان / 51، شعراء / 208). «مُتْرَفُوهَا»: (نگا: اسراء / 16، مؤمنون / 64، سبأ / 34). «أُمَّةٍ»: دین و آئین. «مُقْتَدُونَ»: اقتداءکنندگان. پیروی کنندگان. مقلّدان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و بدین‌سان پیش از تو در هیچ آبادی، هشداردهنده‌ای نفرستادیم مگر آنکه ناز پروردگانش گفتند ما پدرانمان را بر شیوه‌ای یافته‌ایم، و ما در پی آنان دنباله روانیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و این‌گونه در هیچ شهر و دیاری پیش از تو پیامبر انذارکننده‌ای نفرستادیم مگر اینکه ثروتمندان مست و مغرور آن گفتند: «ما پدران خود را بر آئینی یافتیم و به آثار آنان اقتدا می‌کنیم.»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و بدینسان نفرستادیم پیش از تو در شهری ترساننده‌ای جز آنکه گفتند هوسرانانش که یافتیم همانا پدران خویش را بر ملّتی و مائیم هر آینه بر نشانیهای آنان پیروان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و همچنين پيش از تو در هيچ آبادى و شهرى هيچ بيم‌كننده‌اى نفرستاديم مگر آنكه توانگران و كامرانانش گفتند كه ما پدران خود را بر آيينى يافته‌ايم و همانا ما بر پى ايشان مى‌رويم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و بدین گونه در هیچ گروهی پیش از تو هشداردهنده‌ای نفرستادیم، مگر آنکه بی‌بندوبارهای غرق در نعمت‌ها گفتند: «ما پدران خود را بر روشی (هماهنگ در بت‌پرستی) یافته‌ایم و ما از پی ایشان راه‌یافته‌ایم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Thus, We never sent an admonisher to a settlement before you but the decadent among them said. "We found our fathers following this way, and we are walking in their footsteps."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And similarly, whenever We sent a Herald of Warning before you (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him) into any town, its wealthy people said, “We found our forefathers upon a religion, and we are behind their footsteps.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Even so We sent never before thee any warner into any city, except that its men who lived at ease said, 'We indeed found our fathers upon a community, and we are following upon their traces.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And in this wise We sent not before thee into any city a warner but the affluent thereof said: verily we! we found our fathers on a certain way and verily their footsteps we are following.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And similarly, We sent not a warner before you (O Muhammad SAW) to any town (people) but the luxurious ones among them said: "We found our fathers following a certain way and religion, and we will indeed follow their footsteps."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Likewise, We sent no warner before you to any town, but the wealthy among them said, “We found our parents on a course, and we are following in their footsteps.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And thus it is: whenever We sent any warner to a city its affluent ones said: “We found our forefathers on a way and we continue to follow in their footsteps.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And similarly, We sent not a warner before you to any town (people) but the luxurious ones among them said: "We found our fathers following a certain way and religion, and we will indeed follow their footsteps."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And even so We sent not a warner before thee (Muhammad) into any township but its luxurious ones said: Lo! we found our fathers following a religion, and we are following their footprints.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So it has been that We did not send any warner to a town before you, without its affluent ones saying, ‘We found our fathers following a creed and we are indeed following in their footsteps.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: As such, We never sent a warner before you to a village, except those living in luxury said: 'We found our fathers following a creed, and by following in their footsteps we are guided'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And similarly, We did not send before you any warner into a city except that its affluent said, "Indeed, we found our fathers upon a religion, and we are, in their footsteps, following."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: In the same way, whenever We had sent a Messenger before you to warn a town, the rich ones therein said, "We found our fathers following a certain belief and we follow in their footsteps.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And thus, We did not send before you any warner in a town, but those who led easy lives in it said: Surely we found our fathers on a course, and surely we are followers of their footsteps.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wakathalika ma arsalna min qablika fee qaryatin min natheerin illa qala mutrafooha inna wajadna abaana AAala ommatin wainna AAala atharihim muqtadoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Whenever We sent a messenger before you to warn a township, the affluent among them said, in the same way, "We saw our fathers following this tradition; we are only following in their footsteps."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Just in the same way, whenever We sent a Warner before thee to any people, the wealthy ones among them said: "We found our fathers following a certain religion, and we will certainly follow in their footsteps."

verses.text: قَالَ‌ أَ وَ لَوْ جِئْتُکُمْ‌ بِأَهْدَى‌ مِمَّا وَجَدْتُمْ‌ عَلَيْهِ‌ آبَاءَکُمْ‌ قَالُوا إِنَّا بِمَا أُرْسِلْتُمْ‌ بِهِ‌ کَافِرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [بیم دهنده] گفت: آیا هر چند من آیینی هدایت کننده تر از آیینی که پدرانتان را بر آن یافته اید، برایتان بیاورم؟ گفتند: ما به آیینی که به آن فرستاده شده اید، کافریم!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفت: حتى اگر براى شما چيزى بياورم كه از آنچه پدرانتان را بر آن يافته بوديد هدايت‌كننده‌تر باشد؟ گفتند: ما به آيينى كه شما را بدان فرستاده‌اند بى‌ايمانيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [پيامبرشان‌] گفت: حتى اگر براى شما چيزى بياورم كه از آنچه پدران خود را بر آن يافته‌ايد، هدايت كننده‌تر باشد [باز هم از آنها پيروى مى‌كنيد] گفتند: ما [نسبت‌] به آنچه بدان فرستاده شده‌ايد كافريم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: گفت «هر چند هدايت كننده‌تر از آنچه پدران خود را بر آن يافته‌ايد براى شما بياورم؟» گفتند: «ما [نسبت‌] به آنچه بدان فرستاده شده‌ايد كافريم.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آن رسول ما به آنان گفت: اگر چه من به آیینی بهتر از دین (باطل) پدرانتان شما را هدایت کنم (باز هم پدران را تقلید می‌کنید)؟ آنها پاسخ دادند (به هر تقدیر) ما به آنچه شما را به رسالت آن فرستاده‌اند کافریم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (پیغمبرشان بدیشان) می‌گفت: آیا اگر من آئینی را هم برای شما آورده باشم که از آئینی هدایت‌بخش‌تر باشد که پدران و نیاکان خود را بر آن یافته‌اید (باز هم از گذشتگان خود پیروی می‌کنید و بر بت‌پرستی‌خویش می‌روید و دست به دامان تقلید می‌شوید؟) می‌گفتند: (آری! چنین است و) اصلاً ما به چیزی که (با خود آورده‌اید و) بدان مأمور و مبعوث شده‌اید، باور نداریم. [[«أُرْسِلْتُم بِهِ»: همراه با آن فرستاده شده‌اید و برای تبلیغ آن برانگیخته شده‌اید.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بگو حتی اگر برای شما راهنماتر از آنچه پدرانتان را پیرو آن یافتید، بیاورم؟ گفتند ما رسالت شما را منکریم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (پیامبرشان) گفت: «آیا اگر من آیینی هدایت‌بخش‌تر از آنچه پدرانتان را بر آن یافتید آورده باشم (باز هم انکار می‌کنید)؟!» گفتند: «(آری،) ما به آنچه شما به آن فرستاده شده‌اید کافریم!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت و اگر چه بیارم شما را به راهنماتر از آنکه یافتید بر آن پدران خویش را گفتند همانا مائیم بدانچه فرستاده شدید بدان کافران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: [آن بيم‌كننده‌] گفت: آيا هر چند شما را رهنمون‌تر از آنچه پدرانتان را بر آن يافته‌ايد بياورم [باز هم بر پيروى از آنها باقى مى‌مانيد]؟ گفتند: ما بدانچه شما به آن فرستاده شده‌ايد كافريم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفت‌: «آیا و هر چند من راهوارتر از آنچه پدرانتان را بر آن یافته‌اید برایتان بیاورم‌؟» گفتند: «ما (نسبت) به آنچه بدان فرستاده شده‌اید بی‌چون کافریم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: "Even if I bring you a better guidance," he rejoined, "than the one you found your fathers on?" Still they said: "We do not believe in what you have brought."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: The prophet said, “What! Even if I bring to you a path better than what you found your forefathers following?”; they said, “We do not believe in whatever you have been sent with.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Say: 'What, though I should bring you a better guidance than you found your fathers upon?' They say, 'We disbelieve in that you were sent with.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: The warner said: What! even though bring you a better guidance than that which ye found your fathers upon They said: verily in that wherewith ye are sent we are disbelievers.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: (The warner) said: "Even if I bring you better guidance than that which you found your fathers following?" They said: "Verily, We disbelieve in that with which you have been sent."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He would say, “Even if I bring you better guidance than what you found your parents following?” They would say, “We reject what you are sent with.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Each Prophet asked them: “Will you do so even if we were to show you a way better than the way of your forefathers?” They answered: “We disbelieve in the religion with which you have been sent.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: He said: "Even if I bring you better guidance than that which you found your fathers following" They said: "Verily, we disbelieve in that with which you have been sent."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: (And the warner) said: What! Even though I bring you better guidance than that ye found your fathers following? They answered: Lo! in what ye bring we are disbelievers.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He would say, ‘What! Even if I bring you a better guidance than what you found your fathers following?!’ They would say, ‘We indeed disbelieve in what you are sent with.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Say: 'What then if I bring you a better guidance than that you found your fathers following' But they reply: 'We disbelieve in that you have been sent with.'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [Each warner] said, "Even if I brought you better guidance than that [religion] upon which you found your fathers?" They said, "Indeed we, in that with which you were sent, are disbelievers."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The Messengers would say, "Would you still follow in the footsteps of your fathers even if I was to bring you better guidance?" They would say, "We have no faith in your message".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: (The warner) said: What! even if I bring to you a better guide than that on which you found your fathers? They said: Surely we are unbelievers in that with which you are sent.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala awalaw jitukum biahda mimma wajadtum AAalayhi abaakum qaloo inna bima orsiltum bihi kafiroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Each messenger said, "What if I should bring you better guidance than what you found your forefathers had?" They replied, "We reject any message you have been sent with!"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: He said: "What! Even if I brought you better guidance than that which ye found your fathers following?" They said: "For us, we deny that ye (prophets) are sent (on a mission at all)."

verses.text: فَانْتَقَمْنَا مِنْهُمْ‌ فَانْظُرْ کَيْفَ‌ کَانَ‌ عَاقِبَةُ الْمُکَذِّبِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: در نتیجه از آنان انتقام گرفتیم. پس با تأمل بنگر سرانجام تکذیب کنندگان چگونه بود.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس، از آنها انتقام گرفتيم. و بنگر كه عاقبت تكذيب‌كنندگان چگونه بوده است؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس، از آنها انتقام گرفتيم پس بنگر كه عاقبت تكذيب كنندگان چگونه شد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس، از آنان انتقام گرفتيم. پس بنگر فرجام تكذيب‌كنندگان چگونه بوده است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: ما هم از آن مردم (پر غرور و عناد) انتقام کشیدیم، بنگر تا عاقبت حال کافران مکذّب به کجا کشید؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پس ما از ایشان انتقام گرفته‌ایم (و آنان را به مجازات سخت دنیوی گرفتار ساخته‌ایم. ای مخاطب اندیشمند) بنگر عاقبت کار تکذیب‌کنندگان (پیغمبران، به کجا کشیده است و) چگونه شده است. [[«فَانتَقَمْنَا مِنْهُمْ»: (نگا: اعراف / 136، حجر / 79، روم / 47). «فَانظُرْ»: مخاطب پیغمبر اسلام یا هر شنونده و خواننده‌ای است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آنگاه از ایشان داد ستاندیم، پس بنگر که سرانجام دروغ انگاران چه بوده است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: به همین جهت از آنها انتقام گرفتیم؛ بنگر پایان کار تکذیب‌کنندگان چگونه بود!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس انتقام گرفتیم از ایشان پس بنگر چگونه بود عاقبت تکذیب‌کنندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس، از آنها كين ستانديم، و بنگر كه سرانجام تكذيب‌كنندگان چگونه بود!

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس، از آنان انتقام گرفتیم. پس بنگر فرجام تکذیب‌کنندگان چگونه بوده است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Then We punished them. So look at the fate of those who denied.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So We took revenge from them – therefore see what sort of fate befell those who denied!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: So We took vengeance upon them; and behold how was the end of them that cried lies.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Wherefore We took revenge on them. Behold, then how hath been the end of the beliers?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So We took revenge of them, then see what was the end of those who denied (Islamic Monotheism).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So We wreaked vengeance upon them. Behold, then, what was the fate of those who deny.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Then We exacted retribution from them. So do consider the end of those who gave the lie (to the Prophets).

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So We took revenge on them, then see what was the end of those who denied.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: So We requited them. Then see the nature of the consequence for the rejecters!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Thereupon We took vengeance on them; so observe how was the fate of the deniers.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: So We took vengeance upon them, and see how the end was of those who lied.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So we took retribution from them; then see how was the end of the deniers.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We took revenge on them. See how terrible the end of those who rejected (Or revelations) was!

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So We inflicted retribution on them, then see how was the end of the rejecters.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faintaqamna minhum faonthur kayfa kana AAaqibatu almukaththibeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: So We wreaked Our vengeance on them: now see what was the end of those who rejected [the Truth]!

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: So We exacted retribution from them: now see what was the end of those who rejected (Truth)!

verses.text: وَ إِذْ قَالَ‌ إِبْرَاهِيمُ‌ لِأَبِيهِ‌ وَ قَوْمِهِ‌ إِنَّنِي‌ بَرَاءٌ مِمَّا تَعْبُدُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و [یاد کن] هنگامی را که ابراهیم به پدر و قومش گفت: من بی تردید از آنچه می پرستید، بیزارم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و ابراهيم به پدر و قومش گفت: من از آنچه شما مى‌پرستيد بيزارم،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و [ياد كن‌] هنگامى را كه ابراهيم به پدر و قوم خود گفت: من واقعا از آنچه مى‌پرستيد بيزارم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و چون ابراهيم به [نا]پدرى خود و قومش گفت: «من واقعاً از آنچه مى‌پرستيد بيزارم،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (یاد آر) وقتی که ابراهیم با پدر (یعنی عموی خود) و قومش گفت: من از معبودان شما سخت بیزارم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (ای پیغمبر!) برای تکذیب‌کنندگان معاصر بیان کن گوشه‌ای از داستان ابراهیم را. وقتی ابراهیم به پدر و قوم خود گفت: من از معبودهائی که می‌پرستید بیزارم. [[«بَرَآءٌ»: بری (نگا: انعام / 78، انفال / 48، ممتحنه / 4). بیزار. در اصل مصدر است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و چنین بود که ابراهیم به پدرش و قومش گفت همانا من از آنچه می‌پرستید بری و برکنارم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و به خاطر بیاور هنگامی را که ابراهیم به پدرش [= عمویش آزر] و قومش گفت: «من از آنچه شما می‌پرستید بیزارم.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و هنگامی که گفت ابراهیم به پدر خویش و قومش که منم همانا بیزار از آنچه می‌پرستید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و [ياد كن‌] آنگاه كه ابراهيم به پدر و قوم خود گفت: من از آنچه مى‌پرستيد بيزارم،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و چون ابراهیم به پدر (تربیتی) خود و قومش گفت: «من همواره از آنچه و آن‌گونه که می‌پرستید بیزارم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: When Abraham said to his father and his people: "I am rid of what you worship

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And when Ibrahim said to his father and his people, “I have no relation whatsoever with your deities.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And when Abraham said to his father and his people, 'Surely I am quit of that you serve,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And recall what time Ibrahim said Unto his father and his people: verily I am quit of that which ye worship.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And (remember) when Ibrahim (Abraham) said to his father and his people: "Verily, I am innocent of what you worship,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: When Abraham said to his father and his people, “I am innocent of what you worship.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Call to mind when Abraham said to his father and his people: “I totally disown all whom you serve

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And (remember) when Ibrahim said to his father and his people: "Verily, I am innocent of what you worship,"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And when Abraham said unto his father and his folk: Lo! I am innocent of what ye worship

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: When Abraham said to his father and his people, ‘I repudiate what you worship,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: (Remember) when Abraham, said to his father and his nation: 'I am quit from what you worship,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Abraham said to his father and his people, "Indeed, I am disassociated from that which you worship

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: When Abraham said to his father and his people, "I boldly renounce what you worship

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And when Ibrahim said to his father and his people: Surely I am clear of what you worship,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waith qala ibraheemu liabeehi waqawmihi innanee baraon mimma taAAbudoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Call to mind when Abraham said to his father and his people, "I disown utterly that which you worship.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Behold! Abraham said to his father and his people: "I do indeed clear myself of what ye worship:

verses.text: إِلاَّ الَّذِي‌ فَطَرَنِي‌ فَإِنَّهُ‌ سَيَهْدِينِ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: مگر کسی که مرا آفریده، که یقیناً او مرا هدایت می کند،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: مگر آن كه مرا آفريده، كه او راهنماييم خواهد كرد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: مگر آن كس كه مرا آفريد كه البته او به زودى مرا هدايت خواهد كرد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: مگر [از] آن كس كه مرا پديد آورد؛ و البته او مرا راهنمايى خواهد كرد.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و جز آن خدایی که مرا آفریده و البته مرا هدایت خواهد کرد نمی‌پرستم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بجز آن معبودی که مرا آفریده است. (او را خواهم پرستید) چرا که او مرا (به راه حق) رهنمود خواهد کرد. [[«فَطَرَنِی»: مرا از نیستی به هستی آورده است. «سَیَهْدِینِ»: مرا هدایت خواهد کرد. یاء ضمیر حذف شده است. فعل مضارع با وجود حرف استقبال، در اینجا برای استمرار حال و آینده است. چرا که همین واژه در سوره شعراء، آیه 78 بدون آن آمده است و قصّه یکی است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: مگر از کسی که مرا آفریده است و همو مرا هدایت فرماید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: مگر آن کسی که مرا آفریده، که او هدایتم خواهد کرد!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: مگر آنکه مرا آفرید که او زود است رهبریم کند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: مگر آن [خداى‌] كه مرا آفريده كه او مرا راهنمايى خواهد كرد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «مگر آن که بر فطرت (توحیدی)ام آفرید. پس (هم) او مرا همواره به زودی راهنمایی خواهد کرد.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Other than Him who created me. He will show me the right way."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “Except Him Who has created me, for He will soon direct me.” (To my place of migration.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: except Him who originated me; and He will guide me.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Save Him Who hath created me, and then He would guide me.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "Except Him (i.e. I worship none but Allah Alone) Who did create me, and verily, He will guide me."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Except for He who created me, for He will guide me.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: except the One Who created me; and, behold, it is He Who will direct me to the Right Way.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "Except Him Who created me; and verily, He will guide me."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Save Him Who did create me, for He will surely guide me.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: excepting Him who originated me; indeed He will guide me.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: except Him who originated me, for He will guide me'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Except for He who created me; and indeed, He will guide me."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: except for the One who has created me and will guide me".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Save Him Who created me, for surely He will guide me.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Illa allathee fataranee fainnahu sayahdeeni

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: [I worship] only Him who created me, and He will certainly guide me,"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "(I worship) only Him Who made me, and He will certainly guide me."

verses.text: وَ جَعَلَهَا کَلِمَةً بَاقِيَةً فِي‌ عَقِبِهِ‌ لَعَلَّهُمْ‌ يَرْجِعُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و توحید و یکتاپرستی را در نسل های بعد از خود حقیقتی پایدار قرار داد، باشد که آنان [به سوی توحید] بازگردند؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و اين سخن را در فرزندان خود سخنى پاينده كرد، باشد كه به خدا باز گردند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اين [سخن يكتاپرستى‌] را در نسل او سخنى ماندگار قرار داد، باشد كه [به سوى خدا] بازگردند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و او آن را در پى خود سخنى جاويدان كرد، باشد كه آنان [به توحيد] بازگردند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و خدا این خدا پرستی را در همه ذرّیّت او تا قیامت کلمه باقی گردانید، باشد که (همه فرزندانش به خدای یکتا) رجوع کنند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ابراهیم توحید را به عنوان شعار یکتاپرستی در میان قوم خود باقی گذاشت، تا این که ایشان (بدان ایمان آورده و) برگردند. [[«جَعَلَهَا»: مرجع ضمیر فاعلی فعل (جَعَلَ) خدا یا ابراهیم است. ضمیر (ها) به کلمه توحید، یعنی (لآ إِلهَ إِلاَّ اللهُ) برمی‌گردد که مفهوم از مجموع (الَّذِی فَطَرَنِی) و (إِنَّنِی بَرَآءٌ مِّمَّا تَعْبُدُونَ) است. یا این که مرجع (هذِهِ الْمَقَالَة) است که از فحوای کلام پیدا است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و آن [اندیشه توحید] را سخنی ماندگار در میان احفاد او قرار داد، باشد که به راه آیند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: او کلمه توحید را کلمه پاینده‌ای در نسلهای بعد از خود قرار داد، شاید به سوی خدا باز گردند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و گردانید آن را سخنی پایدار از پس خویش (یا در نژاد خویش) شاید ایشان بازگردند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و آن- يعنى كلمه توحيد- را در فرزندان خود سخنى پاينده كرد تا شايد [قومش و ديگر مشركان از شرك به دين توحيد و خدا پرستى‌] باز گردند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و آن (فطرت توحیدی) را در پی بازماندگانش کلمه‌ای استوار ]: درست و ثابت[ قرار داد، شاید آنان (به خدا) بازگردند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: This is the legacy he left to his descendants so that they may turn (to God).

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And Ibrahim kept this declaration among his progeny, in order that they may desist.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And he made it a word enduring among his posterity; haply so they would return.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And he made it a word lasting among his posterity that haply they should return.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And he made it [i.e. La ilaha ill-Allah (none has the right to be worshipped but Allah Alone)] a Word lasting among his offspring (True Monotheism), that they may turn back (i.e. to repent to Allah or receive admonition).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And he made it an enduring word in his progeny, so that they may return.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And Abraham left behind this word to endure among his posterity so that they may return to it.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And he made it a word lasting among his offspring, that they may turn back.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And he made it a word enduring among his seed, that haply they might return.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He made it a lasting word among his posterity so that they may come back [to the right path].

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: He made this an abiding word among his descendants, in order that they would return.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And he made it a word remaining among his descendants that they might return [to it].

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: God made (belief in one God) an everlasting task for his successors, so that perhaps they would return (to Him).

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And he made it a word to continue in his posterity that they may return.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: WajaAAalaha kalimatan baqiyatan fee AAaqibihi laAAallahum yarjiAAoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and he left these words to endure among his descendants, so that they might return [to God].

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And he left it as a Word to endure among those who came after him, that they may turn back (to Allah).

verses.text: بَلْ‌ مَتَّعْتُ‌ هٰؤُلاَءِ وَ آبَاءَهُمْ‌ حَتَّى‌ جَاءَهُمُ‌ الْحَقُ‌ وَ رَسُولٌ‌ مُبِينٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [نه اینکه بازنگشتند و من هم از آنان انتقام نگرفتم] بلکه اینان [که در مکه آلوده به بت پرستی هستند] و پدرانشان را [از انواع نعمت ها] برخوردار کردم تا آنکه حق و فرستاده ای روشنگر [چون قرآن و محمّد] به سویشان آمد؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و من اينان و پدرانشان را از زندگى بهره‌مند كردم تا آنگاه كه حق و پيامبرى روشنگر به سويشان آمد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بلكه اينان و پدرانشان را برخوردار كردم تا اين كه حق و فرستاده‌اى روشنگر به سويشان آمد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بلكه اينان و پدرانشان را برخودارى دادم تا حقيقت و فرستاده‌اى آشكار به سويشان آمد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (و من تعجیل در عقوبت کافران نکردم) بلکه آنان و پدرانشان را (مهلت داده و از عمر) بهره‌مند کردم تا آنکه دین حق و رسول مبین بر آنها آمد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (مشرکان امید ابراهیم را برآورده نکردند و برنامه‌اش را پیاده ننمودند و من هم در عقوبت ایشان عجله‌ای نکردم) بلکه من اینان و پدرانشان را از مواهب دنیا بهره‌مند ساختم تا (قرآن فراخواننده‌ی مردمان به) حق (و حقیقت)، و پیغمبر روشنگری به نزدشان آمد. [[«مَتَّعْتُ»: بهره‌مند ساختم. مهلت دادم. «الْحَقُّ»: حقیقت. مراد قرآن است. «مُبِینٌ»: روشنگر و بیانگر. واضح و روشن. یعنی پیغمبری که رسالتش ثابت و روشن است. مراد حضرت محمّد است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آری اینان و پدرانشان را بهره‌مند ساخته‌ام تا آنکه [دین‌] حق و پیامبری آشکار به نزد آنان آمد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ولی من این گروه و پدرانشان را از مواهب دنیا بهره‌مند ساختم تا حق و فرستاده آشکار (الهی) به سراغشان آمد؛

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بلکه بهره‌مند ساختم ایشان و پدران ایشان را تا بیامدشان حقّ و فرستاده‌ای آشکار

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بلكه اينان- كفار مكه- و پدرانشان را برخوردار كردم تا حق- قرآن- و فرستاده‌اى آشكار و روشنگر- محمد

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بلکه اینان و پدرانشان را برخوداری‌ای دادم، تا حقیقت و فرستاده‌ای آشکارگر سویشان آمد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: In fact, I allowed them and their fathers to enjoy this life till the truth, and the apostle preaching it lucidly, came to them.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: In fact I gave them and their forefathers the usage of this world until the truth and the Noble Messenger who conveyed the message clearly, came to them.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Nay, but I gave these and their fathers enjoyment of days, until the truth came unto them, and a manifest Messenger.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Aye! I let these and their fathers enjoy life, until there hath come Unto them the truth and an apostle manifest.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Nay, but I gave (the good things of this life) to these (polytheists) and their fathers to enjoy, till there came to them the truth (the Quran), and a Messenger (Muhammad SAW) making things clear.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: I gave these and their forefathers some enjoyment, until the truth and a manifest messenger came to them.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (Even when they began worshipping others than Allah We did not destroy them) but bestowed sustenance on them and on their forefathers until there came to them the Truth and a Messenger who clearly expounded things to them.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Nay, but I gave to these and their fathers to enjoy, till there came to them the truth, and a Messenger making things clear.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Nay, but I let these and their fathers enjoy life (only) till there should come unto them the Truth and a messenger making plain.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed, I provided for these and their fathers until the truth and a manifest apostle came to them.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: I gave them and their fathers days of enjoyment until the truth and a clear Messenger came to them.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: However, I gave enjoyment to these [people of Makkah] and their fathers until there came to them the truth and a clear Messenger.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: In fact, We allowed them and their fathers to enjoy themselves until the truth and a strong Messenger came to them.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Nay! I gave them and their fathers to enjoy until there came to them the truth and an Apostle making manifest (the truth).

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Bal mattaAAtu haolai waabaahum hatta jaahumu alhaqqu warasoolun mubeenun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Yes, I gave the good things of this life to these [men] and their fathers, until the truth came to them, and a messenger expounding things clearly,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Yea, I have given the good things of this life to these (men) and their fathers, until the Truth has come to them, and a messenger making things clear.

verses.text: وَ لَمَّا جَاءَهُمُ‌ الْحَقُ‌ قَالُوا هٰذَا سِحْرٌ وَ إِنَّا بِهِ‌ کَافِرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و هنگامی که حق به سویشان آمد، گفتند: این جادوست و ما به آن کافریم،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: چون حق بر آنها آشكار شد گفتند: اين جادوست و ما بدان ايمان نمى‌آوريم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و چون حق به سويشان آمد گفتند: اين افسون است و ما بدان كافريم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و چون حقيقت به سويشان آمد، گفتند: «اين افسونى است و ما منكر آنيم.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و چون حق به سوی آنها آمد گفتند: این (قرآن) سحر است و ما به (وحی بودن) آن ایمان نداریم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: هنگامی که قرآن به پیش ایشان آمد، گفتند: این جادو است و ما بدان باور نداریم. [[«الْحَقُّ»: قرآن (نگا: زخرف / 29 و 31).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و چون [دین‌] حق به نزد آنان آمد، گفتند این جادوست و ما منکر آنیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: هنگامی که حق به سراغشان آمد؛ گفتند: «این سحر است، و ما نسبت به آن کافریم»!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و هنگامی که بیامدشان حقّ گفتند این است جادوئی و همانا مائیم بدان کافران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و آنگاه كه حق بديشان آمد گفتند: اين جادوست و ما به آن كافريم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و چون آن حقیقت سویشان آمد، گفتند: «این افسونی است، و ما بی‌گمان به آن کافرانیم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Yet when the truth had come to them, they said: "This is sorcery. We shall never believe in it."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And when the truth came to them they said, “This is magic, and we disbelieve in it.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And when the truth came to them, they said, 'This is a sorcery, and in it we are unbelievers.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And when the truth cometh Unto them, they say this is magic, and verily we are therein disbelievers.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And when the truth (this Quran) came to them, they (the disbelievers in this Quran) said: "This is magic, and we disbelieve therein."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But when the truth came to them, they said, “This is sorcery, and we refuse to believe in it.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And when the Truth came to them they said: “This is just sorcery and we reject it.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And when the truth came to them, they said: "This is magic, and we disbelieve therein."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And now that the Truth hath come unto them they say: This is mere magic, and lo! we are disbelievers therein.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: But when the truth came to them, they said, ‘This is magic, and we indeed disbelieve in it.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: But when the truth came to them, they said: 'This is sorcery, we disbelieve in it'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But when the truth came to them, they said, "This is magic, and indeed we are, concerning it, disbelievers."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: When the truth came to them, they said, "This is magic and we have no faith in it".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And when there came to them the truth they said: This is magic, and surely we are disbelievers in it.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Walamma jaahumu alhaqqu qaloo hatha sihrun wainna bihi kafiroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: but when the truth came to them, they said, "This is sorcery, and we reject it."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But when the Truth came to them, they said: "This is sorcery, and we do reject it."

verses.text: وَ قَالُوا لَوْ لاَ نُزِّلَ‌ هٰذَا الْقُرْآنُ‌ عَلَى‌ رَجُلٍ‌ مِنَ‌ الْقَرْيَتَيْنِ‌ عَظِيمٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و گفتند: این قرآن چرا بر مردمی بزرگ از میان یکی از این دو شهر [مکه و طایف] نازل نشد؟!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفتند: چرا اين قرآن بر مردى از بزرگمردان آن دو قريه نازل نشده است؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و گفتند: چرا اين قرآن بر مردى بزرگ از آن دو قريه [مكه و طائف‌] نازل نشده است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و گفتند: «چرا اين قرآن بر مردى بزرگ از [آن‌] دو شهر فرود نيامده است؟»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و باز گفتند: چرا این قرآن بر آن مرد بزرگ قریه مکّه و طایف (ولید و حبیب یا عروة بن مسعود) نازل نشد؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: گفتند: چرا این قرآن بر مرد بزرگواری از یکی از دو شهر (مکّه و طائف) فرو فرستاده نشده است؟! [[«رَجُلٍ»: مرد بزرگوار. مرادشان مردی سرشناس و ثروتمند است. هرچند منظورشان چه بسا شخص معیّنی نباشد، ولی اغلب گفته‌اند مرادشان ولید پسر مغیره مخزومی از مکّه، و عروه پسر مسعود ثقفی از طائف بود. «الْقَرْیَتَیْنِ»: دو شهر. مرادشان مکّه و طائف بود.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و گفتند چرا این قرآن بر مردی بزرگ از آن دو شهر [مکه و طائف‌] فرود نیامده است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و گفتند: «چرا این قرآن بر مرد بزرگ (و ثروتمندی) از این دو شهر (مکه و طائف) ناز ل نشده است؟!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و گفتند چرا فرستاده نشد این قرآن بر مردی از دو شهر بزرگواری‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و گفتند: چرا اين قرآن بر مردى بزرگ- از جهت مال و جاه- از اين دو شهر- مكّه و طائف- فروفرستاده نشده است؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و گفتند: «چرا این قرآن بر مردی بزرگ‌(منش) از (آن) دو مجتمع [:مکه وطائف] فرود نیامده است‌؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They also said: "Why was this Qur'an not sent down to some great man of the two cities?"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And they said, “Why was the Qur’an not sent down upon some chieftain of these two great towns?” (The chiefs of Mecca and Taif).

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: They say, 'Why was this Koran not sent down upon some man of moment in the two cities?'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And they say: wherefore hath not this Qur'an been revealed to a man of the two cities who was great.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And they say: "Why is not this Quran sent down to some great man of the two towns (Makkah and Ta'if)?"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They also said, “If only this Quran was sent down to a man of importance from the two cities.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They say: “Why was this Qur'an not sent down upon some great man from the two (main) cities?”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And they say: "Why is not this Qur'an sent down to some great man of the two towns"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And they say: If only this Qur'an had been revealed to some great man of the two towns?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: And they said, ‘Why was not this Quran sent down to some great man from the two cities?’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: They also said: 'Why was this Koran not sent down to a great man from the two Villages'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And they said, "Why was this Qur'an not sent down upon a great man from [one of] the two cities?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Then they said, "Why this Quran had not been revealed to a man from either of the two great towns".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And they say: Why was not this Quran revealed to a man of importance in the two towns?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waqaloo lawla nuzzila hatha alquranu AAala rajulin mina alqaryatayni AAatheemun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They said, "Why was this Quran not sent down to one of the great men of the two cities?"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Also, they say: "Why is not this Qur'an sent down to some leading man in either of the two (chief) cities?"

verses.text: أَ هُمْ‌ يَقْسِمُونَ‌ رَحْمَةَ رَبِّکَ‌ نَحْنُ‌ قَسَمْنَا بَيْنَهُمْ‌ مَعِيشَتَهُمْ‌ فِي‌ الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا وَ رَفَعْنَا بَعْضَهُمْ‌ فَوْقَ‌ بَعْضٍ‌ دَرَجَاتٍ‌ لِيَتَّخِذَ بَعْضُهُمْ‌ بَعْضاً سُخْرِيّاً وَ رَحْمَةُ رَبِّکَ‌ خَيْرٌ مِمَّا يَجْمَعُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا آنان هستند که رحمت پروردگارت را تقسیم می کنند؟ ما در زندگی دنیا معیشت آنان را میانشان تقسیم کرده ایم، و برخی را از جهت درجات [فکری و مادی] بر برخی برتری داده ایم تا برخی از آنان برخی دیگر را [در امر معیشت و سایر امور] به خدمت گیرند؛ و رحمت پروردگارت از آنچه آنان جمع می کنند، بهتر است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا آنان از رحمت پروردگارت را تقسيم مى‌كنند؟ حال آنكه ما روزى آنها را در زندگى دنيا ميانشان تقسيم مى‌كنيم. و بعضى را به مرتبت، بالاتر از بعضى ديگر قرار داده‌ايم تا بعضى بعض ديگر را به خدمت گيرند. و رحمت پروردگارت از آنچه آنها گرد مى‌آورند بهتر است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: مگر رحمت پروردگار تو را آنها تقسيم مى‌كنند؟ اين ماييم كه معيشت آنها را در زندگى دنيا ميانشان تقسيم كرده‌ايم، و بعضى از آنها را بر بعضى مراتبى برترى داديم تا يكديگر را به خدمت گيرند [و چرخه زندگى بگردد]، و رحمت پروردگار تو از آنچه مى‌اندوزند بهتر است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا آنانند كه رحمت پروردگارت را تقسيم مى‌كنند؟ ما [وسايل‌] معاش آنان را در زندگى دنيا ميانشان تقسيم كرده‌ايم، و برخى از آنان را از [نظر] درجات، بالاتر از بعضى [ديگر] قرار داده‌ايم تا بعضى از آنها بعضى [ديگر] را در خدمت گيرند، و رحمت پروردگار تو از آنچه آنان مى‌اندوزند بهتر است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا آنها باید فضل و رحمت خدای تو را تقسیم (و مقام نبوت را تعیین) کنند؟ در صورتی که ما خود معاش و روزی آنها را در حیات دنیا تقسیم کرده‌ایم و بعضی را بر بعضی به درجاتی (از مال و جاه دنیوی) برتری داده‌ایم تا بعضی از مردم (به ثروت) بعضی دیگر را مسخر خدمت کنند، و (بهشت، دار) رحمت خدا از آنچه (از مال دنیا) جمع می‌کنند بسی بهتر است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا آنان رحمت پروردگار تو را تقسیم می‌کنند (و کلید رسالت را به هر کس که بخواهند می‌سپارند؟). این مائیم که معیشت آنان را در زندگی دنیا میانشان تقسیم کرده‌ایم. و برخی را بر برخی دیگر برتریهائی داده‌ایم، تا بعضی از آنان بعضی دیگر را به کار گیرند (و به یکدیگر خدمت کنند). و رحمت پروردگارت از تمام آنچه جمع‌آوری می‌کنند بهتر است (که نبوّت است و نبوّت از همه‌ی مقامات برتر است). [[«رَحْمَة»: در رسم‌الخطّ قرآنی با تاء کشیده نوشته شده است. «مَعِیشَتَهُمْ»: قوت زندگی ایشان، از قبیل: خوردنی و نوشیدنی. «دَرَجَاتٍ»: مراتب. مراد تفاوت در استعدادها و لیاقتها و اعمال و ارزاق است. «سُخْرِیّاً»: مسخّر. زیر فرمان. به کار گرفته شده. منسوب به (سُخْرَه) است. «لِیَتَّخِذَ بَعْضُهُم بَعْضاً سُخْرِیّاً»: تسخیر در اینجا به معنی بهره‌کشی ظالمانه نیست، بلکه منظور به کار گرفتن عموم مردم برای خدمت به یکدیگر و چرخاندن زندگی تعاونی و ایجاد نظم در اجتماع است. چرخش زندگی و نظم بدون تفاوتها امکان‌پذیر نیست. همه انسانها آزادند و باید نیروهای متفاوت و خلاّق خود را به کار گیرند و نبوغ جوراجور خود را شکوفا سازند و از نتایج فعّالیّتهای خویش بی‌کم و کاست بهره گیرند و در رفع نارسائیها بکوشند. انسانها همچون ظروف یکدستی نیستند که در یک کارخانه، یک شکل و یک نواخت و یک اندازه و با یک نوع فایده، ساخته شده باشند. همچنین انسانها مانند پیچ و مهره‌های یک ماشین هم نیستند که سازنده مربوطه آنها را تنظیم کرده باشد و به گونه اجبار به کار معیّن خود ادامه دهند. بلکه انسانها در عین تفاوت استعدادها و لیاقتها، آزادی اراده و مسؤولیّت دارند. اگر جز این بود، زندگی برای انسانها ناممکن می‌گردید. «رَحْمَةُ»: مراد نبوّت، و سعادت دارین مترتّب بر آن است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا ایشان رحمت پروردگارت را تقسیم می‌کنند [نه بلکه‌] ما زیستمایه‌شان را در زندگانی دنیا در میان آنان تقسیم می‌کنیم، و بعضی از ایشان را بر بعضی دیگر به درجاتی برتر داشتیم تا بعضی از آنان بعضی دیگر را به بیگاری بگیرند، و رحمت پروردگارت بهتر است از آنچه گرد می‌آورند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا آنان رحمت پروردگارت را تقسیم می‌کنند؟! ما معیشت آنها را در حیات دنیا در میانشان تقسیم کردیم و بعضی را بر بعضی برتری دادیم تا یکدیگر را مسخر کرده (و با هم تعاون نمایند)؛ و رحمت پروردگارت از تمام آنچه جمع‌آوری می‌کنند بهتر است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا آنان پخش کنند رحمت پروردگار تو را ما قسمت کردیم میان ایشان روزی ایشان را در زندگانی دنیا و برتری دادیم برخی از ایشان را بر برخی در پایه‌ها تا بگیرد بعضی از آنان بعضی را مسخره و رحمت پروردگار تو بهتر است از آنچه گرد آرند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا آنها رحمت پروردگار تو- نبوت- را بخش مى‌كنند؟ ماييم كه ميان آنان مايه گذرانشان را در زندگانى دنيا بخش كرده‌ايم، و پايه‌هاى برخى را بر برخى برتر داشته‌ايم- در روزى و جاه- تا برخى برخ ديگر را به خدمت گيرند و بخشايش پروردگار تو از آنچه گرد مى‌آورند بهتر است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آیا (هم) ایشان رحمت پروردگارت را تقسیم می‌کنند؟ ماییم که (‌وسایل) معاشِ آنان را در زندگی دنیا میانشان تقسیم کرده‌ایم و برخی از آنان را درجاتی (مادی و نه روحانی) بالاتر از بعضی (دیگر) داده‌ایم، تا بعضی از آنها بعضی (دیگر) را به خدمت برگیرند. و رحمت پروردگارت از آنچه آنان می‌اندوزند بهتر است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Are they the ones who dispense the favour of your Lord? It is He who apportions the means of livelihood among them in this world, and raises some in position over the others to make some others submissive. The favours of your Lord are better than what they amass.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Are they the distributors of your Lord’s mercy? We have distributed among them their comforts in the life of this world, and gave high status to some over others so that they mock at each other; and the mercy of your Lord is better than all what they hoard.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: What, is it they who divide the mercy of the Lord? We have divided between them their livelihood in the present life, and raised some of them above others in rank, that some of them may take others in servitude; and the mercy of thy Lord is better than that they amass.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Shall they apportion their Lord's mercy? It is We Who have apportioned among them their livelihood in the life of the War, and raised some of them over others in degrees, so that one of them may take another as a serf; and the mercy of thy Lord is better than that which they amass.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Is it they who would portion out the Mercy of your Lord? It is We Who portion out between them their livelihood in this world, and We raised some of them above others in ranks, so that some may employ others in their work. But the Mercy (Paradise) of your Lord (O Muhammad SAW) is better than the (wealth of this world) which they amass.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Is it they who allocate the mercy of your Lord? It is We who have allocated their livelihood in this life, and We elevated some of them in rank above others, that some of them would take others in service. But your Lord’s mercy is better than what they amass.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Is it they who distribute the Mercy of your Lord? It is We Who have distributed their livelihood among them in the life of this world, and have raised some above others in rank that some of them may harness others to their service. Your Lord's Mercy is better than all the treasures that they hoard.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Is it they who would portion out the mercy of your Lord It is We Who portion out between them their livelihood in this world, and We raised some of them above others in ranks, so that some may employ others in their work. But the mercy of your Lord is better than what they amass.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Is it they who apportion thy Lord's mercy? We have apportioned among them their livelihood in the life of the world, and raised some of them above others in rank that some of them may take labour from others; and the mercy of thy Lord is better than (the wealth) that they amass.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Is it they who dispense the mercy of your Lord? It is We who have dispensed among them their livelihood in the present life, and raised some of them above others in rank, so that some may take others into service, and your Lord’s mercy is better than what they amass.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: What, is it they who divide the Mercy of your Lord! (It is) We who divided between them their livelihoods in this life, raising some in rank above others, sothat some may take the other into his service. Your Lord's Mercy is better than all they gather.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Do they distribute the mercy of your Lord? It is We who have apportioned among them their livelihood in the life of this world and have raised some of them above others in degrees [of rank] that they may make use of one another for service. But the mercy of your Lord is better than whatever they accumulate.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do they distribute the mercy of your Lord? It is We who have distributed their sustenance in this world and raised the positions of some of them above the others so that they would mock each other. The mercy of your Lord is better than what they can amass.
