translations.text: و هنگامی که بیامد عیسی به نشانیها گفت همانا آوردم شما را به حکمت و تا بیان کنم برای شما پاره آنچه را در آن اختلاف دارید پس بترسید خدا را و مرا فرمان برید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و چون عيسى با نشانه‌ها و دلايل روشن آمد، گفت: همانا براى شما حكمت- سخن درست و استوار در عقايد و اخلاق- آورده‌ام [تا بدان راه يابيد] و تا برخى از آنچه را كه در باره آن اختلاف مى‌كنيد برايتان بيان كنم. پس، از خداى پروا كنيد و مرا فرمان بريد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و چون عیسی با دلایل آشکار آمد، گفت: «به‌راستی شما را حکمت آوردم و تا درباره‌ی بعضی از آنچه در آن اختلاف می‌کنید برایتان توضیح دهم. پس از خدا پروا کنید و فرمانم ببرید.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: When Jesus came with the signs, he said: "I have come to you with authority, and to explain some thing about which you are at variance. So fear God, and follow me.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And when Eisa came to them with clear signs, he said, “I have come to you with wisdom, and to explain to you some of the matters regarding which you dispute; therefore fear Allah, and obey me.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And when Jesus came with the clear signs he said, 'I have come to you with wisdom, and that I may make clear to you some of that whereon you are at variance; so fear you God and obey you me.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And when Isa came with; evidences, he said: of a surety I have come Unto you with Wisdom, and to expound Unto you some of that wherein ye differ; so fear Allah and obey me.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And when 'Iesa (Jesus) came with (Our) clear Proofs, he said: "I have come to you with Al-Hikmah (Prophethood), and in order to make clear to you some of the (points) in which you differ, therefore fear Allah and obey me,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: When Jesus came with the clarifications, he said, “I have come to you with wisdom, and to clarify for you some of what you differ about. So fear God, and obey me.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: When Jesus came with Clear Signs and said: “I have brought wisdom to you that I may make plain to you some of the things you differ about. So fear Allah and follow me.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And when `Isa came with clear proofs, he said: "I have come to you with Al-Hikmah, and in order to make clear to you some of that in which you differ. Therefore have Taqwa of Allah and obey me."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: When Jesus came with clear proofs (of Allah's Sovereignty), he said: I have come unto you with wisdom, and to make plain some of that concerning which ye differ. So keep your duty to Allah, and obey me.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: When Jesus brought those manifest proofs, he said, ‘I have certainly brought you wisdom, and [I have come] to make clear to you some of the things that you differ about. So be wary of Allah and obey me.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And when (Prophet) Jesus came with clear signs, he said: 'I have come to you with wisdom and to clarify to you some of the matters about which you differ. Fear Allah and obey me.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And when Jesus brought clear proofs, he said, "I have come to you with wisdom and to make clear to you some of that over which you differ, so fear Allah and obey me.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: When Jesus came with clear proof (in support of his truthfulness), he said, "I have come to you with wisdom to clarify for you some of the matters in which you have disputes. Have fear of God and obey me.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And when Isa came with clear arguments he said: I have come to you indeed with wisdom, and that I may make clear to you part of what you differ in; so be careful of (your duty to) Allah and obey me:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Walamma jaa AAeesa bialbayyinati qala qad jitukum bialhikmati waliobayyina lakum baAAda allathee takhtalifoona feehi faittaqoo Allaha waateeAAooni

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: When Jesus came with clear signs, he said, "Now I have come to you with wisdom, in order to make clear to you some of the things about which you dispute: therefore fear God and obey me.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: When Jesus came with Clear Signs, he said: "Now have I come to you with Wisdom, and in order to make clear to you some of the (points) on which ye dispute: therefore fear Allah and obey me.

verses.text: إِنَ‌ اللَّهَ‌ هُوَ رَبِّي‌ وَ رَبُّکُمْ‌ فَاعْبُدُوهُ‌ هٰذَا صِرَاطٌ مُسْتَقِيمٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بی تردید خدا پروردگار من و پروردگار شماست، پس او را بپرستید که این است راه راست.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: خداى يكتا پروردگار من و پروردگار شماست. او را بپرستيد. راه راست اين است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بى‌ترديد خداوند [يكتا]، همو پروردگار من و پروردگار شماست، پس [تنها] او را بپرستيد كه راه راست همين است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: در حقيقت، خداست كه خود پروردگار من و پروردگار شماست. پس او را بپرستيد؛ اين است راه راست.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: همانا خدای یکتا پروردگار من و شماست، تنها پرستش او کنید که این راه راست است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: به طور قطع خداوند پروردگار من و پروردگار شما است، پس او را پرستش کنید، راه راست این است. [[«رَبِّی وَ رَبُّکُمْ»: تکرار واژه (رَبّ) برای این است که تأکید شود عیسی نیز همچون سایر انسانها انسان، و نیازمند پروردگاراست و پرستش را نسزد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بی‌گمان خداوند پروردگار من است و پروردگار شماست، او را بپرستید که راه راست همین است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: خداوند پروردگار من و پروردگار شماست؛ (تنها) او را پرستش کنید که راه راست همین است!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا خدا است پروردگار من و پروردگار شما پس بپرستیدش این است راهی راست‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: همانا خداى يكتا پروردگار من و پروردگار شماست، پس او را بپرستيد، اين است راه راست.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «همانا خداست (که) او پروردگار من و پروردگار شماست. پس او را بپرستید؛ این راهی است بس راست.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Verily God is my Lord and your Lord; so worship Him. This is the straight path."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “Allah is indeed my Lord, and yours – therefore worship Him; this is the Straight Path.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Assuredly God is my Lord and your Lord; therefore serve Him; this is a straight path.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily Allah! He is my lord and your Lord, so worship Him: this is the straight path.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "Verily, Allah! He is my Lord (God) and your Lord (God). So worship Him (Alone). This is the (only) Straight Path (i.e. Allah's religion of true Islamic Monotheism)."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: God is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him—this is a straight path.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Allah is my Lord and your Lord; therefore, serve Him. That is the Straight Way.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "Verily, Allah! He is my Lord and your Lord. So worship Him. This is the straight path."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! Allah, He is my Lord and your Lord. So worship Him. This is a right path.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed Allah is my Lord and your Lord; so worship Him. This is a straight path.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Indeed, Allah is my Lord and your Lord, therefore worship Him. That is the Straight Path'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, Allah is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. This is a straight path."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: God is your Lord and my Lord, so worship Him. This is the right path".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Surely Allah is my Lord and your Lord, therefore serve Him; this is the right path:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Inna Allaha huwa rabbee warabbukum faoAAbudoohu hatha siratun mustaqeemun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: For God, He is my Lord and your Lord: so worship Him: that is a straight path."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "For Allah, He is my Lord and your Lord: so worship ye Him: this is a Straight Way."

verses.text: فَاخْتَلَفَ‌ الْأَحْزَابُ‌ مِنْ‌ بَيْنِهِمْ‌ فَوَيْلٌ‌ لِلَّذِينَ‌ ظَلَمُوا مِنْ‌ عَذَابِ‌ يَوْمٍ‌ أَلِيمٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: از میان امت عیسی گروه هایی [درباره او و دینش] اختلاف کردند [و هر یک چون نسطوریه، ملکانیه، مرقوسیه و شمعونیه به عقیده ای خلاف حق پای بند شدند، و آیینی غیر آیین مسیح را به عنوان آیین مسیح برگزیدند] پس وای بر کسانی که [به آیات خدا] ستم ورزیدند از عذاب روزی دردناک.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گروه‌ها با هم اختلاف كردند. پس واى بر ستمكاران از عذاب دردآور قيامت.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس گروه‌ها از ميان خودشان [در باره‌ى مسيح‌] اختلاف كردند. پس واى بر كسانى كه ستم كردند از عذاب روزى دردناك

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: تا [آنكه‌] از ميانشان، احزاب دست به اختلاف زدند، پس واى بر كسانى كه ستم كردند از عذاب روزى دردناك!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: باز فرق یهود و نصارا بین خود اختلاف انداختند، پس وای بر ستمکاران عالم از عذاب دردناک روز قیامت.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: گروهها و دسته‌ها (ی اهل کتاب نسبت به عیسی) در میان خود به اختلاف پرداختند (و هر یک او را به نامی‌خواندند و راه افراط و تفریط در پیش گرفتند). وای بر کسانی که ستم کردند! چه عذاب دردناکی در روز قیامت گریبانگیرشان می‌گردد! [[«الأحْزَابُ»: (نگا: مریم / 37).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: ولی گروه مشرکان در میان خود به اختلاف سخن گفتند، پس وای بر ستمگران [مشرک‌] از عذاب روزی سهمگین‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ولی گروه‌هایی از میان آنها (درباره مسیح) اختلاف کردند (و بعضی او را خدا پنداشتند)؛ وای بر کسانی که ستم کردند از عذاب روزی دردناک!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس اختلاف کردند احزاب از میان ایشان پس وای برای آنان که ستم کردند از عذاب روزی دردناک‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: اما آن گروه‌ها- ترسايان- ميان خود [در باره او] اختلاف كردند، پس واى بر ستمكاران از عذاب روزى دردناك.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس از میانشان، احزاب (ستمگر) دست به اختلاف زدند. پس وای از عذاب روزی دردناک برای کسانی که ستم کردند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: But the factions differed among themselves. Woe alas to the sinners for the torment of the grievous Day!

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Then the groups differed amongst themselves; therefore ruin is for the unjust by the punishment of an agonising day.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: But the parties among them fell into variance; so woe unto those who did evil, because of the chastisement of a painful day.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then the sects differed among themselves. Woe then Unto those who do Wrong because of the torment of an afflictive Day.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: But the sects from among themselves differed. So woe to those who do wrong (by ascribing things to 'Iesa (Jesus) that are not true) from the torment of a painful Day (i.e. the Day of Resurrection)!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But the factions differed among themselves. So woe to the wrongdoers from the suffering of a painful Day.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Then the factions fell apart among themselves. So woe to the wrong-doers from the chastisement of a grievous Day.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: But the sects from among themselves differed. So woe to those who do wrong from the torment of a painful Day!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: But the factions among them differed. Then woe unto those who do wrong from the doom of a painful day.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: But the factions differed among themselves. So woe to the wrongdoers for the punishment of a painful day.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Yet the parties differed among themselves. So woe to those who did evil among the punishment of a Painful Day.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But the denominations from among them differed [and separated], so woe to those who have wronged from the punishment of a painful Day.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: But certain groups created differences among themselves. Woe to the unjust. They will face a painful torment.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: But parties from among them differed, so woe to those who were unjust because of the chastisement of a painful day.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faikhtalafa alahzabu min baynihim fawaylun lillatheena thalamoo min AAathabi yawmin aleemin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: The various factions among them differed -- woe then to those who did wrong: they will suffer the punishment of a painful Day.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But sects from among themselves fell into disagreement: then woe to the wrong-doers, from the Penalty of a Grievous Day!

verses.text: هَلْ‌ يَنْظُرُونَ‌ إِلاَّ السَّاعَةَ أَنْ‌ تَأْتِيَهُمْ‌ بَغْتَةً وَ هُمْ‌ لاَ يَشْعُرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا جز این انتظاری دارند که ناگاه قیامت در رسد در حالی که نمی فهمند؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا چشم به راه چيزى جز قيامتند كه ناگاه و بى‌خبرشان بيايد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا جز رستاخيز را چشم به راهند كه ناگهان به سراغشان آيد در حالى كه بى‌خبرند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا جز [اين‌] انتظار مى‌برند كه رستاخيز -در حالى كه حدس نمى‌زنند- ناگهان بر آنان در رسد؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا به جز ساعت قیامت را انتظار می‌کشند که ناگاه بر آنها فرا می‌رسد و آنها غافل (از خدا) و بی‌خبر (از روز قیامت) اند؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا منتظر همین هستند که قیامت ناگهانی و در حالی که از آن بی‌خبرند به سروقتشان بیاید؟ [[«هَلْ یَنظُرُونَ ...»: مراد آیه، بیان حال واقعی کافران و مذمّت ایشان است. «السَّاعَةَ»: قیامت. «بَغْتَةً»: ناگهانی. (نگا: انعام / 31 و 47).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: انتظار ندارند مگر قیامت را که به ناگهان به سراغشان آید و ایشان ناآگاه باشند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا جز این انتظار دارند که قیامت ناگهان به سراغشان آید در حالی که نمی‌فهمند؟

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا چشم به راهند جز ساعت را که بیایدشان ناگاه و ایشان ندانند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا جز رستاخيز را چشم براه‌اند كه ناگهان بديشان آيد در حالى كه آگاه نباشند؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آیا جز (این) انتظار می‌برند و می‌نگرند، که ساعت (قیامت) - در حالی که حدس نمی‌زنند - ناگهان آنان را در رسد؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Are they waiting (for any thing) but the Hour (of Doom) which would descend upon them suddenly, and catch them unawares?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: What are they waiting for – except the Last Day, that it may suddenly come upon them while they are unaware?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Are they looking for aught but the Hour, that it shall come upon them suddenly, when they are not aware?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: They await but the Hour: that it should come upon them of a sudden, while they perceive not.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Do they only wait for the Hour that it shall come upon them suddenly, while they perceive not?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Are they only waiting for the Hour to come upon them suddenly, while they are unaware?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Are they awaiting anything other than the Last Hour that it should suddenly come upon them without their even perceiving it?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Do they only wait for the Hour that it shall come upon them suddenly while they perceive not

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Await they aught save the Hour, that it shall come upon them suddenly, when they know not?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Do they not consider that the Hour may overtake them suddenly while they are unaware?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Are they looking for anything except the Hour (to overtake them). It will come upon them suddenly when they are unaware!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Are they waiting except for the Hour to come upon them suddenly while they perceive not?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Are they waiting for the Hour of Doom when the torment will suddenly strike them and they will not even realize from where it came?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Do they wait for aught but the hour, that it should come! upon them all of a sudden while they do not perceive?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Hal yanthuroona illa alssaAAata an tatiyahum baghtatan wahum la yashAAuroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Are they merely waiting for the Hour, which will come upon them suddenly and take them unawares?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Do they only wait for the Hour - that it should come on them all of a sudden, while they perceive not?

verses.text: الْأَخِلاَّءُ يَوْمَئِذٍ بَعْضُهُمْ‌ لِبَعْضٍ‌ عَدُوٌّ إِلاَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: در آن روز دوستان دشمن یکدیگرند مگر پرهیزکاران.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: در آن روز دوستان -غير از پرهيزگاران- دشمن يكديگرند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: در آن روز دوستان، بعضى دشمن بعضى ديگرند، مگر پرهيزگاران

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: در آن روز، ياران -جز پرهيزگاران- بعضى‌شان دشمن بعضى ديگرند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: در آن روز دوستان همه با یکدیگر دشمنند به جز متقیان.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: دوستان، در آن روز، دشمنان یکدیگر خواهند شد، مگر پرهیزگاران. [[«الأخِلآّءُ»: جمع خَلیل، دوستان. رفیقان. مراد دوستان بی‌دین دنیائی است. امّا دوستان دیندار دنیائی، در قیامت نیز دوستان و عزیزان یکدیگرند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: دوستان در چنین روزی، بعضی دشمن بعض دیگر باشند، مگر پرهیزگاران‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: دوستان در آن روز دشمن یکدیگرند، مگر پرهیزگاران!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: دوستان در آن روز بعضیشان بعضی را دشمنند مگر پرهیزکاران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: دوستان- كه دوستيشان در راه كفر و گناه است- در آن روز برخى دشمن برخ ديگرند، مگر پرهيزگاران- كه دوستى ايشان براى خدا و در راه خداست-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: در آن روز، همگی دوستان - جز پرهیزگاران - بعضیشان دشمن بعضی دیگرند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Friends will turn into enemies on that day, except those who fear and follow the straight path.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Close friends will turn into enemies of one another on that Day, except the pious.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Friends on that day shall be foes to one another, but the god-fearing.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: The intimate friends on that Day Will be hostile Unto one another save the God-fearing.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Friends on that Day will be foes one to another except Al-Muttaqun (pious - see V. 2:2).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: On that Day, friends will be enemies of one another, except for the righteous.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: On that Day even bosom friends shall become enemies to one another, all except the God-fearing.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Friends on that Day will be foes one to another except those who have Taqwa.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Friends on that day will be foes one to another, save those who kept their duty (to Allah).

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: On that day, friends will be one another’s enemies, except for the Godwary.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: On that Day close friends shall become enemies of each other, except those who fear (Allah).

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Close friends, that Day, will be enemies to each other, except for the righteous

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: All intimate friends on that day will become each others enemies except for the pious,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: The friends shall on that day be enemies one to another, except those who guard (against evil).

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Alakhillao yawmaithin baAAduhum libaAAdin AAaduwwun illa almuttaqeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: On that Day, friends will become each other's enemies, except the righteous --

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Friends on that day will be foes, one to another,- except the Righteous.

verses.text: يَا عِبَادِ لاَ خَوْفٌ‌ عَلَيْکُمُ‌ الْيَوْمَ‌ وَ لاَ أَنْتُمْ‌ تَحْزَنُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [خدا آن روز به آنان گوید:] ای بندگان من! امروز نه بیمی بر شماست و نه اندوهگین می شوید؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اى بندگان من، در آن روز بيمى بر شما نيست و شما غمگين نمى‌شويد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: اى بندگان من! امروز بر شما بيمى نيست و شما غمگين نخواهيد شد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: اى بندگان من، امروز بر شما بيمى نيست و غمگين نخواهيد شد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (آن روز خطاب شود) الا ای بندگان (صالح) من، امروز شما را هیچ ترس و حزنی نخواهد بود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ای بندگان (پرهیزگار) من! امروز نه بیمی بر شما است (که عذاب و عقابی گریبانگیرتان شود) و نه غم و اندوهی دارید. [[«یَا عِبَادِی»: مراد بندگان مؤمن و متّقی است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: ای بندگانم امروز نه بیمی بر شماست و نه اندوهگین شوید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ای بندگان من! امروز نه ترسی بر شماست و نه اندوهگین می‌شوید!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: ای بندگان من نیست بیمی بر شما امروز و نه اندوهگین باشید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: اى بندگان من، امروز نه بيمى بر شماست و نه اندوهگين مى‌شويد

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: ای بندگان من! امروز بر شما بیمی نیست و نه شما غمگین می‌شوید:

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: O My creatures, there will be no fear or regret

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: To such will be said, “O My bondmen! This day there shall be no fear upon you, nor any grief.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: 'O My servants, today no fear is on you, neither do you sorrow' --

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: O My bondmen! no fear shall be on you Today, nor shall ye grieve

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: (It will be said to the true believers of Islamic Monotheism): My worshippers! No fear shall be on you this Day, nor shall you grieve,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: O My servants, you have nothing to fear on that Day, nor will you grieve.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (It will be said to them): “My servants, today you have nothing to fear or regret,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: My servants! No fear shall be on you this Day, nor shall you grieve,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: O My slaves! For you there is no fear this day, nor is it ye who grieve;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: [They will be told,] ‘O My servants! Today you will have no fear, nor will you grieve

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: O My worshipers, there is no fear for you on this Day, nor will you grieve

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [To whom Allah will say], "O My servants, no fear will there be concerning you this Day, nor will you grieve,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: whom God will tell, "My servants, you need have no fear on this day, nor will you be grieved".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: O My servants! there is no fear for you this day, nor shall you grieve.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Ya AAibadi la khawfun AAalaykumu alyawma wala antum tahzanoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: "O My servants, you need not fear this Day, nor shall you grieve" --

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: My devotees! no fear shall be on you that Day, nor shall ye grieve,-

verses.text: الَّذِينَ‌ آمَنُوا بِآيَاتِنَا وَ کَانُوا مُسْلِمِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: همانان که به آیات ما ایمان آوردند و همواره تسلیم [فرمان ها و احکام] ما بودند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آن كسان كه به آيات ما ايمان آورده‌اند و تسليم امر ما شده‌اند،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: همان كسانى كه به آيات ما ايمان آوردند و تسليم بودند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: همان كسانى كه به آيات ما ايمان آورده و تسليم بودند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آنان که به آیات ما ایمان آوردند و تسلیم امر ما شدند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آن بندگانی که به آیه‌های ما ایمان آورده‌اند و مسلمان و مطیع فرمان (آفریدگار خود) بوده‌اند. [[«مُسْلِمِینَ»: مسلمانان. تسلیم‌شدگان اوامر یزدان. منقادان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: کسانی که به آیات ما ایمان آورده‌اند و مسلمان هستند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: همان کسانی که به آیات ما ایمان آوردند و تسلیم بودند.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آنان که ایمان آوردند به آیتهای ما و بودند اسلام‌آرندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آنان كه به آيات ما ايمان آوردند و مسلمان بودند

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: کسانی که به آیاتمان ایمان آورده و تسلیم (ما) بوده‌اند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: For (those of) you on that day who believed in My revelations and submitted.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Those who believed in Our signs, and were Muslims.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: even those who believed in Our signs, and had surrendered themselves

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Ye who believed in Our revelations and were Muslims.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: (You) who believed in Our Ayat (proofs, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) and were Muslims (i.e. who submit totally to Allah's Will, and believe in the Oneness of Allah - Islamic Monotheism).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Those who believed in Our revelations, and were submissive.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: you who believed in Our Signs and had surrendered yourselves (to Us)!

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: (You) who believed in Our Ayat and were Muslims.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: (Ye) who believed Our revelations and were self-surrendered,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: —those who believed in Our signs and had been Muslims.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: to those who believed in Our verses and were Muslims,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [You] who believed in Our verses and were Muslims.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Those who have faith in Our revelations and have submitted themselves to Our will,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Those who believed in Our communications and were submissive:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Allatheena amanoo biayatina wakanoo muslimeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: those who believed in Our revelations and surrendered themselves to Us.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: (Being) those who have believed in Our Signs and bowed (their wills to Ours) in Islam.

verses.text: ادْخُلُوا الْجَنَّةَ أَنْتُمْ‌ وَ أَزْوَاجُکُمْ‌ تُحْبَرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [ندا آید:] شما و همسرانتان در نهایت خوشحالی و شادمانی به بهشت درآیید؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: شما و جفتهايتان با شادكامى به بهشت داخل شويد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: شما و همسرانتان شادمانه داخل بهشت شويد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: شما با همسرانتان شادمانه داخل بهشت شويد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (به همه خطاب رسد که) شما با همسرانتان مسرور و شادمان در بهشت جاوید وارد شوید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: شما و همسرانتان به بهشت درآئید، در آنجا شادمان و شادکام و مکرّم و محترم خواهید بود. [[«تُحْبَرُونَ»: غرق شادمانی می‌گردید. مکرّم و محترم می‌شوید (نگا: روم / 15).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: شما و همسرانتان شادمانه به بهشت درآیید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (به آنها خطاب می‌شود:) شما و همسرانتان در نهایت شادمانی وارد بهشت شوید!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: درآئید به بهشت شما و همسرانتان شادمانان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: [به آنان گفته شود:] شما و همسرانتان به بهشت در آييد شادان و خرمان- گرامى‌داشتگان-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: شما با همگنانتان به شادمانی داخل بهشت شوید.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: (You will) enter the garden, you and your spouses, and be glad."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “Enter Paradise – you and your wives – and you will be honoured guests.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: 'Enter Paradise, you and your wives, walking with joy!'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Enter the Garden, ye and your spouses, joyfully.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Enter Paradise, you and your wives, in happiness.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Enter the Garden, you and your spouses, Joyfully.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Enter Paradise joyfully, both you and your spouses.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Enter Paradise, you and your wives, in happiness.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Enter the Garden, ye and your wives, to be made glad.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Enter paradise, you and your spouses, rejoicing.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: (it will be said) 'You and your spouses, enter, walking with joy into Paradise'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Enter Paradise, you and your kinds, delighted."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: will be told, "Enter Paradise with your spouses in delight.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Enter the garden, you and your wives; you shall be made happy.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Odkhuloo aljannata antum waazwajukum tuhbaroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: "Enter the Garden rejoicing, both you and your spouses!"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Enter ye the Garden, ye and your wives, in (beauty and) rejoicing.

verses.text: يُطَافُ‌ عَلَيْهِمْ‌ بِصِحَافٍ‌ مِنْ‌ ذَهَبٍ‌ وَ أَکْوَابٍ‌ وَ فِيهَا مَا تَشْتَهِيهِ‌ الْأَنْفُسُ‌ وَ تَلَذُّ الْأَعْيُنُ‌ وَ أَنْتُمْ‌ فِيهَا خَالِدُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: ظرف هایی از طلا [که پر از طعام است] و جام هایی [زرین که پر از شراب طهور است] گرداگرد آنان می گردانند، و در آنجا آنچه دل ها می خواهد و چشم ها از آن لذّت می برد، آماده است، و شما [ای پرهیزکاران!] در آن جاودانه اید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: قدحهاى زرين و سبوها را در ميانشان به گردش مى‌آورند. در آنجاست هر چه نفس آرزو كند و ديده از آن لذت ببرد. و در آنجا جاودانه خواهيد بود.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: كاسه‌هاى زرين و سبوهايى برگرد آنها مى‌گردانند و در آن جا هر چه دلخواه آنهاست و مايه لذت ديدگان است وجود دارد، و شما در آن جا جاودانه خواهيد بود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: سينيهايى از طلا و جام‌هايى در برابر آنان مى‌گردانند، و در آنجا آنچه دلها آن را بخواهند و ديدگان را خوش آيد [هست‌] و شما در آن جاودانيد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و بر آن مؤمنان کاسه‌های زرین و کوزه‌های بلورین (مملوّ از انواع طعام لذیذ و شراب طهور) دور زنند و در آنجا هر چه نفوس را بر آن میل و اشتهاست و چشمها را شوق و لذت، مهیّا باشد و شما مؤمنان در آن بهشت جاویدان متنعّم خواهید بود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: برایشان کاسه‌ها و جامهای زرین به گردش انداخته می‌شود، و هرچه دل بخواهد و هرچه چشم از آن لذّت ببرد، در بهشت وجود دارد، و شما در آنجا جاودانه خواهید بود. [[«صِحَافٍ»: جمع صَحْفَة، کاسه. ظرف. «أَکْوَابٍ»: جمع کُوب، لیوان. فنجان. جام. کوزه و تُنگ بی‌دسته (نگا: المصحف المیسّر).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: برگرد آنان سینی‌های زرین و کوزه‌ها را به گردش درآورند و در آنجا هر چه دلها خواهد و دیدگان بپسندد، هست و شما در آنجا جاودانه هستید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (این در حالی است که) ظرفها (ی غذا) و جامهای طلائی (شراب طهور) را گرداگرد آنها می‌گردانند؛ و در آن (بهشت) آنچه دلها می‌خواهد و چشمها از آن لذت می‌برد موجود است؛ و شما همیشه در آن خواهید ماند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گردانیده شود بر ایشان جامهائی از زر و صراحی‌هائی و در آن است آنچه هوس کنند دلها و لذّت برند دیدگان و شمائید در آن جاودانان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: كاسه‌هايى از زر- پُر از طعام- و كوزه‌هايى- از شراب- بر آنان بگردانند، و در آن

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: سینی‌هایی از طلا و جام‌هایی بر گرد آنان گردانده می‌شود و در آنجا آنچه را دل‌ها(شان) اشتها کند و دیدگان‌(شان) لذت برد، هست. و شما در آن جاودانید.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Golden platters and goblets will be passed around, and everything the heart desires and pleases the eye will be there, where you will abide for ever.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “Rounds of golden cups and wine will be presented upon them; and in it is whatever the hearts wish for, and what pleases the eye; and you will stay in it forever.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: There shall be passed around them platters of gold, and cups, therein being whatever the souls desire, and the eyes delight in. 'And therein, you shall dwell forever.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Passed round amongst them will be dishes of gold and goblets, and therein will be whatsoever souls desire and eyes delight in; and ye will be therein abiders.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Trays of gold and cups will be passed round them, (there will be) therein all that the one's inner-selves could desire, all that the eyes could delight in, and you will abide therein forever.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They will be served around with trays of gold, and cups. Therein is whatever the souls desire and delights the eyes. Therein you will stay forever.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Platters and cups of gold shall be passed around them, and there shall be all that they might desire and all that their eyes might delight in. (They shall be told): “Herein shall you abide for ever.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Trays of gold and cups will be passed round them; (there will be) therein all that their souls desire, and all that eyes could delight in and you will abide therein forever.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Therein are brought round for them trays of gold and goblets, and therein is all that souls desire and eyes find sweet. And ye are immortal therein.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They will be served around with golden dishes and goblets, and therein will be whatever the souls desire and eyes delight in. ‘You will remain in it [forever].

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: To them will be passed large platters and cups of gold. There will be all that souls desire and all that eyes delight in. (And it will be said:) 'There you shall live for ever.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Circulated among them will be plates and vessels of gold. And therein is whatever the souls desire and [what] delights the eyes, and you will abide therein eternally.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Golden dishes and cups will be passed among them. All that the souls may desire and that may delight their eyes will be available therein. You will live therein forever.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: There shall be sent round to them golden bowls and drinking-cups and therein shall be what their souls yearn after and (wherein) the eyes shall delight, and you shall abide therein.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Yutafu AAalayhim bisihafin min thahabin waakwabin wafeeha ma tashtaheehi alanfusu watalaththu alaAAyunu waantum feeha khalidoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Dishes and goblets of gold will be passed around them with all that their souls desire and their eyes delight in. "There you will remain forever:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: To them will be passed round, dishes and goblets of gold: there will be there all that the souls could desire, all that their eyes could delight in: and ye shall abide therein (for eye).

verses.text: وَ تِلْکَ‌ الْجَنَّةُ الَّتِي‌ أُورِثْتُمُوهَا بِمَا کُنْتُمْ‌ تَعْمَلُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: این بهشتی است که شما به پاداش اعمالی که همواره انجام می دادید، میراث یافتید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اين بهشتى است كه به پاداش كارهايى كه كرده‌ايد به ميراثش مى‌بريد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اين همان بهشتى است كه به [پاداش‌] آنچه مى‌كرديد وارث آن شده‌ايد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و اين است همان بهشتى كه به [پاداش‌] آنچه مى‌كرديد ميراث يافتيد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: این همان بهشتی است که از اعمال (صالح) خود به ارث یافتید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: این بهشتی است که به سبب کارهائی که می‌کرده‌اید، بدان دست یافته‌اید. [[«أُورِثْتُمُوهَا»: مال شما شده است و به شما رسیده است (نگا: اعراف / 42، مریم / 63).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و این بهشتی است که به خاطر کار و کردارتان به شما رسیده است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: این بهشتی است که شما وارث آن می‌شوید بخاطر اعمالی که انجام می‌دادید!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و این است بهشتی که ارث داده شدیدش بدانچه بودید می‌کردید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و اين است بهشتى كه به پاداش آنچه مى‌كرديد به ميراث مى‌بريد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و آن است همان بهشتی که به آنچه می‌کرده‌اید میراث یافتید.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: This is the Paradise you will inherit (as meed) for your deeds.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “And this is the Paradise which is bequeathed to you, because of your deeds.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: This is the Paradise that you have been given for an inheritance for the things that you were doing.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: This is the Garden which ye have been made to inherit for that which ye have been working.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: This is the Paradise which you have been made to inherit because of your deeds which you used to do (in the life of the world).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Such is the Garden you are made to inherit, because of what you used to do.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Such is the Paradise that you shall inherit by virtue of your good deeds in the life of the world.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: This is the Paradise, which you have been made to inherit because of your deeds that you used to do.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: This is the Garden which ye are made to inherit because of what ye used to do.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: That is the paradise you have been given to inherit for what you used to do.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Such is the Paradise you shall inherit, for the things you did.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And that is Paradise which you are made to inherit for what you used to do.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: This is the Paradise which you have received as your inheritance by virtue of what you have done.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And this is the garden which you are given as an inheritance on account of what you did.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Watilka aljannatu allatee oorithtumooha bima kuntum taAAmaloona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: this is the Garden which you will inherit by virtue of your past deeds,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Such will be the Garden of which ye are made heirs for your (good) deeds (in life).

verses.text: لَکُمْ‌ فِيهَا فَاکِهَةٌ کَثِيرَةٌ مِنْهَا تَأْکُلُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: شما را در آنجا میوه هایی فراوان است که از آنها می خورید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: در آنجا برايتان ميوه‌هاى بسيار هست كه از آنها مى‌خوريد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: در آن جا براى شما ميوه‌هاى فراوان است كه از آن مى‌خوريد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: در آنجا براى شما ميوه‌هايى فراوان خواهد بود كه از آنها مى‌خوريد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: برای شما در آنجا انواع میوه فراوان است که از آن (هر چه خواهید) تناول کنید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: در آنجا برایتان میوه‌های فراوان و جوراجوری است که از آنها می‌خورید و استفاده می‌کنید. [[«مِنْهَا»: برای تبعیض است و این واقعیّت را بیان می‌دارد که میوه‌های بهشتی آن اندازه فراوان است که شما تنها جزئی از آنها را می‌توانید بخورید، چرا که درختان بهشت همیشه پربار و پرثمر است و مجموعه فناناپذیری است (نگا: رعد / 35).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: برای شما در آنجا میوه‌های بسیار هست که از آنها می‌خورید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و در آن برای شما میوه‌های فراوان است که از آن می‌خورید.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: شما را است در آن میوه فراوان که از آن می‌خورید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: شما را در آنجا ميوه بسيار هست كه از آن مى‌خوريد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: در آنجا برای شما میوه‌هایی (فراوان) است (که) از آنها می‌خورید.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: You will have fruits in abundance there to eat.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “For you are many fruits in it, for you to eat therefrom.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Therein you have abundant fruits, whereof you may eat.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: For you therein will be fruits in plenty whereof ye will eat.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Therein for you will be fruits in plenty, of which you will eat (as you desire).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Therein you will have abundant fruit, from which you eat.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Herein you will have abundant fruits of which you will eat.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Therein for you will be fruits in plenty, of which you will eat (as you desire).

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Therein for you is fruit in plenty whence to eat.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: There are abundant fruits for you in it, from which you will eat.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: You shall have therein abundant fruit to eat'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: For you therein is much fruit from which you will eat.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: You will have abundant fruits therein to consume".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: For you therein are many fruits of which you shall eat.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Lakum feeha fakihatun katheeratun minha takuloona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and there is abundant fruit in it for you to eat."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Ye shall have therein abundance of fruit, from which ye shall have satisfaction.

verses.text: إِنَ‌ الْمُجْرِمِينَ‌ فِي‌ عَذَابِ‌ جَهَنَّمَ‌ خَالِدُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بی تردید گناهکاران در عذاب دوزخ جاودانه اند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گناهكاران در عذاب جهنم جاويدانند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: همانا مجرمان در عذاب جهنم ماندگارند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بى‌گمان، مجرمان در عذاب جهنم ماندگارند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بد کاران عالم هم آنجا سخت در عذاب آتش جهنم مخلّدند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بزهکاران، جاودانه در عذاب دورخ می‌مانند. [[«الْمُجْرِمِینَ»: مراد بزهکاران و گناهکاران کفرپیشه است. به قرینه مقابله با مؤمنانی که در آیه‌های قبلی سخن از آنان بود.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بی‌گمان گناهکاران در عذاب دوزخ جاویدانند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (ولی) مجرمان در عذاب دوزخ جاودانه می‌مانند.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا گنهکاران در عذاب دوزخند جاودانان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: همانا بزهكاران در عذاب دوزخ جاويدانند

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: مجرمان بی‌گمان در عذاب جهنّم ماندگارند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: The sinners will certainly dwell for ever in the torment of Hell.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Indeed the criminals will stay in the punishment of hell forever.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: But the evildoers dwell forever in the chastisement of Gehenna

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily the culprits in Hell's torment will be abiders.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Verily, the Mujrimun (criminals, sinners, disbelievers, etc.) will be in the torment of Hell to abide therein forever.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: As for the sinners, they will be in the torment of Hell forever.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: But the evil-doers shall abide in the torment of Hell.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Verily, the criminals will be in the torment of Hell to abide therein forever.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! the guilty are immortal in hell's torment.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed the guilty will remain [forever] in the punishment of hell.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: But the evildoers shall live for ever in the punishment of Gehenna (Hell),

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, the criminals will be in the punishment of Hell, abiding eternally.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The criminals will live forever in the torment of hell. Their torment will not be relieved and they will despair of escaping.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Surely the guilty shall abide in the chastisement of hell.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Inna almujrimeena fee AAathabi jahannama khalidoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: As for the evil-doers, they shall endure forever the torment of Hell,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: The sinners will be in the Punishment of Hell, to dwell therein (for aye):

verses.text: لاَ يُفَتَّرُ عَنْهُمْ‌ وَ هُمْ‌ فِيهِ‌ مُبْلِسُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [عذاب را] از آنان سبک نگردانند و آنان در آنجا [از نجات خود] نومیدند،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: عذابشان كاهش نمى‌يابد و آنها از نوميدى خاموش باشند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [عذاب‌] از آنها كاسته نمى‌شود و ايشان در آن جا نااميدند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [عذاب‌] از آنان تخفيف نمى‌يابد و آنها در آنجا نوميدند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و هیچ از عذابشان کاسته نشود و امید نجات و خلاصی ندارند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: عذابشان کاسته نمی‌گردد و سبک نمی‌شود، و آنان در میان عذاب، اندوهناک و نومید و خاموش می‌مانند. [[«لایُفَتَّرُ»: کاسته نمی‌گردد و سبک نمی‌شود. تخفیف داده نمی‌شود. «مُبْلِسُونَ»: ناامیدشدگان. اندوهگینان. خاموشان از فرط اندوه و از شدّت گرفتاری (نگا: انعام / 44، مؤمنون / 77، روم / 12 و 49).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: [عذاب‌] از ایشان کاهش نیابد و آنان در آن حال دلسردند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: هرگز عذاب آنان تخفیف نمی‌یابد، و در آنجا از همه چیز مأیوسند.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بریده نگردد از ایشان و ایشانند در آن سرافکندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: [عذاب‌] از آنان سبك نشود و آنها در آن نوميد باشند- از بيرون‌شدن از آتش-

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آن (عذاب) از آنان هرگز سستی نمی‌یابد و آنان در آنجا (از سستی آن) نومیدند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: It will not decrease for them; dumb with despair they will stay in it.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And it will never be lightened upon them, and they will remain in it devastated.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: that is not abated for them and therein they are sore confounded.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: It shall not be abated from off them, and they will be therein despondent.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: (The torment) will not be lightened for them, and they will be plunged into destruction with deep regrets, sorrows and in despair therein.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: It will never be eased for them. In it, they will be devastated.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Never will their torment be lightened for them. They shall remain in utter despair.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: (The torment) will not be lightened for them, and they will be plunged into destruction with deep regrets, sorrows and in despair therein.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: It is not relaxed for them, and they despair therein.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: It will not be lightened for them, and they will be despondent in it.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: which will not be lightened for them, and therein they shall be silent.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: It will not be allowed to subside for them, and they, therein, are in despair.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We had not done any injustice to them but they had wronged themselves.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: It shall not be abated from them and they shall therein be despairing.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: La yufattaru AAanhum wahum feehi mublisoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: from which there is no relief: they will remain there in utter despair.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Nowise will the (Punishment) be lightened for them, and in despair will they be there overwhelmed.

verses.text: وَ مَا ظَلَمْنَاهُمْ‌ وَ لٰکِنْ‌ کَانُوا هُمُ‌ الظَّالِمِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و ما بر آنان ستم نکردیم، ولی آنان خود ستمکار بودند،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: ما به آنها ستمى نكرده‌ايم؛ آنها خود به خويشتن ستم كرده‌اند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و ما بر آنها ستم نكرديم بلكه خودشان ستمكار بودند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و ما بر ايشان ستم نكرديم، بلكه خود ستمكار بودند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و ما به آنها ظلم و ستمی نکردیم لیکن آنان خود مردمی ستمکار و ظالم بودند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما بدیشان ستم نکرده‌ایم (که آنان را بدین عذاب گرفتار ساخته‌ایم) ولیکن خودشان به خویشتن ستم کرده‌اند (که با انجام کارهای زشت و بیراهه رفتن، خود را به دوزخ انداخته‌اند). [[«وَ مَا ظَلَمْنَاهُمْ ...»: (نگا: هود / 101، نحل / 118).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و ما در حق ایشان ستم نکردیم، بلکه خود [در حق خویش‌] ستمکار بودند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ما به آنها ستم نکردیم، آنان خود ستمکار بودند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و ستم نکردیم بر ایشان و لیکن بودند ایشان ستمکاران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و ما به آنان ستم نكرديم و ليكن آنان خود ستمكار بودند

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و ما به ایشان ستم نکردیم، بلکه خودشان ستمکاران بوده‌اند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We did not wrong them, they wronged themselves.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And We did not oppress them at all, but they themselves were unjust.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: We never wronged them, but they themselves did the wrong.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And We wronged them not, but they have been the wrong- doers themselves.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: We wronged them not, but they were the Zalimun (polytheists, wrong-doers, etc.).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We did them no injustice, but it was they who were the unjust.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: It is not We Who wronged them; rather, it is they who wronged themselves.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: We wronged them not, but they were the wrongdoers.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: We wronged them not, but they it was who did the wrong.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: We did not wrong them, but they themselves were wrongdoers.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We did not wrong them, but they were harmdoers.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We did not wrong them, but it was they who were the wrongdoers.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They will cry out, "Guard, let your Lord destroy us".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And We are not unjust to them, but they themselves were unjust.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wama thalamnahum walakin kanoo humu alththalimeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We have not wronged them; it was they who were the wrongdoers.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Nowise shall We be unjust to them: but it is they who have been unjust themselves.

verses.text: وَ نَادَوْا يَا مَالِکُ‌ لِيَقْضِ‌ عَلَيْنَا رَبُّکَ‌ قَالَ‌ إِنَّکُمْ‌ مَاکِثُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و فریاد می زنند: ای مالکِ [دوزخ! بگو:] پروردگارت ما را بمیراند [تا از این عذاب نجات یابیم]. [مالک] می گوید: یقیناً شما ماندنی هستید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: فرياد برآورند كه: اى مالك، كاش پروردگار تو ما را بميراند. مى‌گويد: نه، شما در اينجا ماندنى هستيد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و فرياد برآورند: اى مالك! پروردگارت مى‌بايست جان ما را بستاند. او گويد: شما [همچنان‌] ماندگاريد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و فرياد كشند: «اى مالك، [بگو:] پروردگارت جان ما را بستاند.» پاسخ دهد: « شما ماندگاريد.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و (آن دوزخیان، مالک دوزخ را) ندا کنند که ای مالک، از خدای خود بخواه که ما را بمیراند (تا از عذاب برهیم). جواب دهد: شما (در این عذاب) همیشه خواهید بود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آنان فریاد می‌زنند: ای مالک! پروردگارت ما را بمیراند و نابودمان گرداند (تا بیش از این رنج نبریم و از این عذاب دردناک آسوده شویم. او بدیشان) می‌گوید: شما (اینجا) می‌مانید (و مرگ و میر و نیستی و نابودی در کار نیست). [[«مَالِکُ»: نام فرشته‌ای است که رئیس فرشتگان نگهبان دوزخ است. «لِیَقْضِ عَلَیْنَا ...»: ما را نابود گرداند و بمیراند (نگا: فاطر / 36). «مَاکِثُونَ»: درنگ‌کنندگان. توقّف‌کنندگان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و ندا در دهندای "مالک" کاش پروردگارت کار ما را یکسره کند، گوید شما ماندگارید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنها فریاد می‌کشند: «ای مالک دوزخ! (ای کاش) پروردگارت ما را بمیراند (تا آسوده شویم)!» می‌گوید: «شما در این جا ماندنی هستید!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و بانگ برآوردند ای مالک حکم کند بر ما (یکسره کند کار ما را) پروردگارت گوید همانا شمائید ماندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و [چون اميد رهايى ندارند] آواز دهند كه اى مالك- نگهبان آتش دوزخ-، بايد كه پروردگارت ما را بميراند گويد: همانا شما درنگ‌كننده و ماندنى هستيد

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و ندا کردند: «ای مالک! باید پروردگارت جان ما را بستاند.» پاسخ داد: «همانا شما ماندگارید.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They will call (to the keeper of Hell-gate): "O Malik, let your Lord decide our fate." He will answer: "You are to stay."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And they will cry out, “O Malik*, ask your Lord to finish us!” He will answer, “Rather you are to stay (forever).” (*The guard of hell)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And they shall call, 'O

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And -they will cry: O keeper let thy Lord make an end of us. He will say: verily ye shall bide

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And they will cry: "O Malik (Keeper of Hell)! Let your Lord make an end of us." He will say: "Verily you shall abide forever."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And they will cry, “O Malek, let your Lord finish us off.” He will say, “You are staying.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They shall call out: “O Malik, let your Lord put an end to us.” He will reply: “You must stay on in it.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And they will cry: "O Malik (keeper of Hell)! Let your Lord make an end of us." He will say: "Verily, you shall abide forever."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And they cry: O master! Let thy Lord make an end of us. He saith: Lo! here ye must remain.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They will call out, ‘O Malik! Let your Lord finish us off!’ He will say, ‘Indeed you will stay on.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: 'O Malik' (the angel of Hell) they will call out, 'let your Lord put an end to us' But he will answer: 'Here you shall stay'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And they will call, "O Malik, let your Lord put an end to us!" He will say, "Indeed, you will remain."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The angelic guard will say, "You will have to stay.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And they shall call out: O Malik! let your Lord make an end of us. He shall say: Surely you shall tarry.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wanadaw ya maliku liyaqdi AAalayna rabbuka qala innakum makithoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They will cry, "Master, if only your Lord would put an end to us!" But he [the angel] will answer, "No! You are here to stay."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: They will cry: "O Malik! would that thy Lord put an end to us!" He will say, "Nay, but ye shall abide!"

verses.text: لَقَدْ جِئْنَاکُمْ‌ بِالْحَقِ‌ وَ لٰکِنَ‌ أَکْثَرَکُمْ‌ لِلْحَقِ‌ کَارِهُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: به راستی ما حق را برای شما آوردیم، ولی بیشتر شما حق را خوش نداشتید،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: ما شما را با حق آشنا كرديم ولى بيشترتان از حق كراهت داشتيد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: همانا حقيقت را برايتان آورديم، ليكن بيشتر شما حقيقت را خوش نداشتيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: قطعاً حقيقت را برايتان آورديم، ليكن بيشتر شما حقيقت را خوش نداشتيد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: ما راه خدا و آیین حق را برای شما مردم آوردیم و لیکن اکثرتان از قبول حق کراهت (و اعراض) داشتید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (خداوند بدیشان پیام می‌دهد که) ما حق را برای شما آوردیم (و توسّط پیغمبران برایتان فرو فرستادیم) ولی اکثر شما حق را نپسندیدید و آن را دشمن داشتید. [[«لَقَدْ جِئْنَاکُم بِالْحَقِّ»: ما حق را برایتان آوردیم. گوینده می‌تواند خدا، مالک و سایر دستیاران او باشد. مراد از حق، دین راستین و همه حقایق سرنوشت‌ساز است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: به راستی که برای شما [دین و سخن‌] حق را آورده‌ایم، ولی بیشترینه شما ناخواهان حق هستید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ما حق را برای شما آوردیم؛ ولی بیشتر شما از حق کراهت داشتید!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا آوردیم شما را به حقّ و لیکن بیشتر شمائید حقّ را ناخوش‌دارندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: [و خدا فرمايد:] هر آينه حق را براى شما آورديم و ليكن بيشترتان حق را ناخوش مى‌داشتيد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: همواره حق را برایتان آوردیم، لیکن بیشترتان حق را بسی ناپسند می‌‌دارید.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We have brought to you the truth, but most of you despise the truth.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Indeed We have brought the Truth to you, but most of you detest the Truth.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: 'We brought you the truth, but most of you were averse to the truth.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Assuredly We brought the truth Unto you, but most Of you are to the truth averse.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Indeed We have brought the truth (Muhammad SAW with the Quran), to you, but most of you have a hatred for the truth.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We have given you the truth, but most of you hate the truth.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: We brought you the Truth; but to the truth most of you were averse.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Indeed We have brought the truth to you, but most of you have a hatred for the truth.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: We verily brought the Truth unto you, but ye were, most of you, averse to the Truth.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: ‘We certainly brought you the truth, but most of you were averse to the truth.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We brought you the truth, but most of you were averse to the truth.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: We had certainly brought you the truth, but most of you, to the truth, were averse.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We brought you the truth but most of you disliked it".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Certainly We have brought you the truth, but most of you are averse to the truth.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Laqad jinakum bialhaqqi walakinna aktharakum lilhaqqi karihoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We have certainly brought the truth to you: but most of you have an aversion for the truth.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Verily We have brought the Truth to you: but most of you have a hatred for Truth.

verses.text: أَمْ‌ أَبْرَمُوا أَمْراً فَإِنَّا مُبْرِمُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بلکه آنان کار [توطئه و نیرنگ بر ضد حق] را محکم کردند، پس ما هم کار [عذاب] را بر آنان محکم می کنیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا آنها در اعتقاد خويش پاى فشرده‌اند؟ ما هم پاى فشرده‌ايم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بلكه در كار [مخالفت با حق‌] اصرار ورزيدند، ما [نيز بر كيفرشان‌] اصرار مى‌ورزيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: يا در كارى ابرام ورزيده‌اند؟ ما [نيز] ابرام مى‌ورزيم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بلی کافران بر کار (کفر و عصیان) تصمیم گرفتند ما هم (بر کیفر و انتقام ایشان) تصمیم گرفتیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بلکه، آنان تصمیم محکمی (بر توطئه‌ی قتل محمّد) گرفتند و ما نیز اراده‌ی محکم و تغییرناپذیری کردیم (درباره‌ی مجازات سخت و کیفر دادنشان در دنیا و آخرت). [[«أَبْرَمُوا»: عزم را جزم کردند. تصمیم محکمی‌گرفتند. «أَمْراً»: مراد حیله و نیرنگ و توطئه قتل پیغمبر اسلام است. «مُبْرِمُونَ»: تصمیم‌گیرندگان. عزم را جزم‌کنندگان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: یا در کار خود عزم و جزم داشتند، ما نیز جازم هستیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بلکه آنها تصمیم محکم بر توطئه گرفتند؛ ما نیز اراده محکمی (درباره آنها) داریم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بلکه استوار کردند کاری را که مائیم همانا استوارکنان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بلكه [كافران‌] كارى استوار- در ردّ حق- ساختند، پس ما هم [براى كيفر آنها] كارى استوار مى‌سازيم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: یا در کاری (بد) ابرام و استقامت ورزیده‌اند؟ پس ما (نیز در مکافاتشان) همواره استقامت‌کنندگانیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Have they settled upon a plan? We shall also settle on one.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Do they assume that they have made their work thorough? So We shall make Our work thorough.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Or have they contrived some matter? We too are contriving.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Have they determined an affair? then verily We are also determining.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Or have they plotted some plan? Then We too are planning.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Have they contrived some scheme? We too are contriving.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Have they contrived some scheme? If so, We too will contrive a scheme.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Or have they plotted some plan Then We too are planning.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Or do they determine any thing (against the Prophet)? Lo! We (also) are determining.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Have they settled on some [devious] plan? Indeed, We too are settling [on Our plans].

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Or have they devised a matter! We are devising.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Or have they devised [some] affair? But indeed, We are devising [a plan].

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: If the disbelievers persist in their disbelief, We shall also persist in punishing them.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Or have they settled an affair? Then surely We are the settlers.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Am abramoo amran fainna mubrimoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Have they determined upon a course? Then We too are determined.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: What! have they settled some plan (among themselves)? But it is We Who settle things.

verses.text: أَمْ‌ يَحْسَبُونَ‌ أَنَّا لاَ نَسْمَعُ‌ سِرَّهُمْ‌ وَ نَجْوَاهُمْ‌ بَلَى‌ وَ رُسُلُنَا لَدَيْهِمْ‌ يَکْتُبُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا آنان گمان می کنند که ما رازشان و سخنان در گوشی آنان را نمی شنویم؟ چرا می شنویم و فرستادگان ما [که فرشتگان نویسنده اعمال اند] نزد آنان حاضرند [و اعمالشان و رازهایشان را] می نویسند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا مى‌پندارند ما راز و نجوايشان را نمى‌شنويم؟ آرى، رسولان ما نزد آنها هستند و مى‌نويسند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا مى‌پندارند كه ما راز آنها و نجوايشان را نمى‌شنويم؟ چرا [مى‌شنويم‌] و رسولان ما نزد آنها مى‌نويسند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا مى‌پندارند كه ما راز آنها و نجوايشان را نمى‌شنويم؟ چرا، و فرشتگان ما پيش آنان [حاضرند و] ثبت مى‌كنند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا گمان می‌کنند که سخنان سرّی و پنهان که به گوش هم می‌گویند نمی‌شنویم؟ بلی می‌شنویم و رسولان ما (فرشتگان) همان دم آن را می‌نویسند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا گمان می‌برند که ما اسرار پنهانی و سخنان درگوشی آنان را نمی‌شنویم؟! آری! (ما آگاه از راز و رمز ایشان و شنوای نجوای آنان بوده و) گذشته از این، فرشتگان مأمور ما در کنارشان حاضر و بر اعمالشان ناظرند و (همه‌ی کردار و گفتارشان را) می‌نویسند وثبت و ضبط می‌کنند. [[«رُسُلُنَا»: فرستادگان ما. مراد فرشتگان مأمور ضبط و ثبت اعمال است (نگا: / 18، انفطار / 10).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: یا شاید گمان کنند که ما راز و رازگویی‌شان را نمی‌شنویم؟ آری می‌شنویم، و فرشتگان ما نزد ایشان [کار و کردارشان را] می‌نویسند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا آنان می‌پندارند که ما اسرار نهانی و سخنان درگوشی آنان را نمی‌شنویم؟ آری، رسولان (و فرشتگان) ما نزد آنها هستند و می‌نویسند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: یا پندارند که ما نمی‌شنویم نهان ایشان و راز ایشان را بلی و فرستادگان ما نزد ایشانند نویسندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: يا مگر مى‌پندارند كه ما انديشه نهانى و رازگويى آنان با يكديگر را نمى‌شنويم؟ چرا، [مى‌شنويم‌]، و فرستادگان ما- فرشتگان نويسنده اعمال- در نزد آنها مى‌نويسند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: یا می‌پندارند که ما بی‌گمان رازشان و نجوایشان را نمی‌شنویم‌؟ چرا! حال آنکه فرستادگان ما نزدشان (اعمال پیدا و نهانشان را یکسان) می‌نویسند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Or do they think We do not hear their secrecies and stealthy consultations? In fact, Our messengers who attend them record everything.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Do they fancy that We do not listen to their whispers and their counselling? Why not, We surely do! And Our angels are with them, writing down.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Or do they think We hear not their secret and what they conspire together? Yes indeed, and Our messengers are present with them writing it down.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Bethink they that We hear not their secrets and whispers? Yea! We do, and Our messengers present with them write down.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Or do they think that We hear not their secrets and their private counsel? (Yes We do) and Our Messengers (appointed angels in charge of mankind) are by them, to record.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Or do they think that We cannot hear their secrets and their conspiracies? Yes indeed, Our messengers are by them, writing down.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Or do they think that We do not hear their secret talks and their whispering counsels? Yes, indeed We do and Our messengers [i.e., angels) are with them, writing.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Or do they think that We hear not their secrets and their private counsel Yes (We do) and Our messengers are by them, to record.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Or deem they that We cannot hear their secret thoughts and private confidences? Nay, but Our envoys, present with them, do record.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Do they suppose that We do not hear their secret thoughts and their secret talks? Yes indeed [We do]! And with them are Our messengers, writing down [everything].

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Do they think We do not hear their secret and that which they conspire! Yes, indeed Our angels, who are present with them write it down.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Or do they think that We hear not their secrets and their private conversations? Yes, [We do], and Our messengers are with them recording.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do they think that We do not hear their secrets and whispers? We certainly can hear them and Our Messengers record it all.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Or do they think that We do not hear what they conceal and their secret discourses? Aye! and Our apostles with them write down.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Am yahsaboona anna la nasmaAAu sirrahum wanajwahum bala warusuluna ladayhim yaktuboona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Do they imagine We do not hear their secret talk and their private counsels? On the contrary, Our messengers [angels] are at their sides, recording everything.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Or do they think that We hear not their secrets and their private counsels? Indeed (We do), and Our messengers are by them, to record.

verses.text: قُلْ‌ إِنْ‌ کَانَ‌ لِلرَّحْمٰنِ‌ وَلَدٌ فَأَنَا أَوَّلُ‌ الْعَابِدِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [به مشرکان سبک مغز] بگو: اگر برای [خدای] رحمان فرزندی بود، من [در این امت] نخستین پرستنده او بودم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بگو: اگر خداى رحمان را فرزندى مى‌بود، من از نخستين پرستندگان مى‌بودم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بگو: اگر [خداى‌] رحمان را فرزندى باشد، خود من نخستين پرستندگانم [و بايد او را بپرستم‌]

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بگو: «اگر براى [خداى‌] رحمان فرزندى بود، خود من نخستين پرستندگان بودم.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بگو: اگر خدا را فرزندی بود اوّل من او را می‌پرستیدم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
